subject: [Important] Your 1st Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
credited to 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by April 07, 2025 for $0.05 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
Tax Payments report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
TriNet 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© TriNet

subject: How can your organization help women prepare for retirement?
body:
Tips for creating a culture of financial empowerment
View this email as a web page 
here
 
Virtual Event
Supporting Women’s Path to Retirement:
Helping female workers plan
for a more secure future
Women often face unique challenges that can impact their long-term financial security, from the gender pay gap to interruptions in career progression due to pregnancy and caregiving. These factors can make saving for retirement more complex—and often more daunting. Employers can play a critical role in helping women navigate these challenges with confidence by providing financial education and resources that support financial empowerment.
 
Join us
 to learn how your organization can help female employees improve their financial confidence through workplace benefits and financial wellness resources and help encourage better savings habits amongst all employees.
12–1 pm ET Wednesday, April 9, 2025
Register Now  →

Get the latest workplace benefits insights with a variety of content — including articles, checklists, reports, and more — to help support all stages of your employees' journeys.

subject: Spring Reflections in the Workplace and Community
body:
Images: Manuel Cosentino, Hannah Busing, Pedro Lima
Dear Friends,
In May, there are rich occasions for renewal through meditation and the peaceful convocation of people of all faiths and none in the spirit of peace and hope.  
Vesak Day
 is a sacred day observed by millions of Buddhists worldwide. It commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and passing of Siddhartha Gautama, known as the Buddha. Vesak Day is celebrated on varying dates across Buddhist communities due to differing calendars, including this year on May 12th in the United States. On Vesak Day, Buddhists participate in devotions and charitable deeds to honor the Buddha’s teachings on peace, compassion, and ethical conduct.   
The 
National Day of Prayer
 and The 
National Day of Reason
 are observed in the United States on the first Thursday of May, which occurs this year on May 1st. These observances encourage reflection, dialogue, and engagement in community for all people.  
Tanenbaum’s 
Workplace Resources
 page provides holiday fact sheets and best practices for recognizing and respecting employee observances. To learn more about our programs and resources, please contact us at 
info@tanenbaum.org
. 
We’d love to hear from you!   
Warmly, 
Rev. Mark Fowler, CEO, and the Workplace team
 
At this crucial time, you can actively fight religious hatred by supporting Tanenbaum. Our real-world solutions make peace possible in the U.S. and globally.
Donate Today!

subject: Project Forward Weekly Guidance - Issue 6
body:
­ 
April 4, 2025 - Issue #6
 
­ 
 
­ 
 
 
WEEKLY 
GUIDANCE
ABOUT PROJECT FORWARD
Led by BRIDGE, Project FORWARD is a cross-industry initiative, designed to chart our collective path forward and meet the current moment head-on. In partnership with top experts in academia, law and our board members, we are dedicated to equipping, educating, and empowering leaders in diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI), marketing, and business to continue to drive inclusive innovation and sustainable growth.
 
Every Friday, Project FORWARD provides critical updates on executive orders (EO) and legislative developments, featuring legal interpretations from 
Stacy Hawkins, Esq
.
, Diversity & Employment Practices Consultant and Rutgers Professor of Law, and 
Jessica Golden Cortes
, Partner, Labor + Employment Group, Davis+Gilbert LLP. We will also include the BRIDGE POV and tangible actions to consider.*
 
We encourage our community to remain informed and proactive. If you have questions or insights you’d like to share, please email 
projectforward@wearebridge.com
.
 
FOR PAST ISSUES OF PROJECT FORWARD WEEKLY GUIDANCE 
PLEASE VISIT HERE
.
 
*These Project FORWARD updates should not be construed as legal advice or counsel. They are for educational and instructive purposes only, to aid our understanding about how best to actively continue our mission in response to this moment. 
PROJECT FORWARD TOP 10
 
As we have seen over the past weeks, things change day-by-day, minute-by-minute so it’s important to stay pragmatic and focused versus chaotic and reactionary. 
 
Here’s a Project FORWARD Top 10 to consider during this time:
1 - 
NO STIGMA TO EVOLVING:
 In the same way that all business practices evolve, there should be no stigma attached to evolving DEI practices. Despite the collision with politics, the evolution of DEI practices should be subject to the same rigor as other business practices - figure out what’s working and what isn’t, strengthen its attachment to business impact and mitigate risk.
 
2 -
 CONNECT TO BUSINESS OUTCOMES:
 Beyond ensuring full compliance with existing laws, the most powerful way to mitigate risk is to broaden your inclusion efforts across the organization - intentionally tying them to business outcomes and marketplace impact.
 
3 -
 
DRIVING BUSINESS GROWTH: 
Inclusion can be transformational in driving business growth, especially when activating historically untapped communities whose buying power continues to grow in scale and influence (estimated at $6 Trillion).
 
4 - 
SEE, SERVE AND SHOW UP IN THE MARKET: 
Consider your inclusion maturity through a growth lens of how you see, serve and show up in the marketplace.
 
5 - 
COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE VII: 
The Civil Rights Act, and the legal protections it affords, remains unchanged! Continue to review your DEI Practices to ensure that they are compliant with Title VII. For example: internships are open to all applicants, mentorships open to all employees, allies are invited to attend ERGs, etc.
 
6 -
 EXECUTIVE ORDERS ARE NOT LAW: 
An EO is a directive for how the federal government must act under the law. In and of itself, it does not have the force of law; therefore, EOs can be overturned if they violate federal or constitutional law.
 
7 - 
MERIT AND DEI AREN’T MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE: 
The assertion that merit-based hiring is contrary to DEI practices is a false narrative. DEI practitioners have not advocated for hiring unqualified individuals—the role of DEI is to break the systemic structures that have historically excluded qualified talent and expand opportunities to those who have been arbitrarily denied access. Merit and DEI have never been mutually exclusive.
 
8 - 
COMMIT TO YOUR VALUES: 
You cannot please everyone so committing to your company values versus capitulating to the politics of the moment is essential in maintaining trust in your brand. These values guide your mission, goals, culture, decision-making, behaviors, and relationships, serving as a foundation for how your company operates and interacts with employees, customers, and the broader community. 
 
9 - 
ZERO-TOLERANCE POLICY: 
Clearly define a zero-tolerance policy for all forms of discrimination and harassment - ensure it is clearly communicated to your employees.
 
10 -
 TRANSPARENCY IN COMMUNICATIONS: 
Be proactive and transparent in your communications to address questions and to reassure employees, especially those that belong to communities directly targeted, that the recent actions by the federal government do not override their protections under existing law or otherwise undermine the employer's commitment to support them.
­ 
UPDATE ON PREVIOUSLY ISSUED EXECUTIVE ORDERS
For continued reference these are the EOs targeting DEI and LGBTQ+ protections that have been issued:
Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing: Executive Order # 14151
Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Opportunity: Executive Order # 14173
Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government: Executive Order #14168
 
OVERVIEW
On Friday, March 28, 2025, in response to a suit filed by Chicago Women in Trade, a federal judge in Illinois issued 
a temporary restraining order blocking the Department of Labor from implementing a key provision of Trump's executive order
 # 14173 aimed at requiring federal grant recipients and contractors to certify that they do not operate Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives in violation of Trump's anti-DEI orders.
 
Judge Matthew Kennelly of the US District of Illinois 
ruled the certification requirement is unconstitutionally vague and, coupled with the threat of financial penalties, would likely violate free speech rights.
 The preliminary injunction motion is set for an in-person hearing next Thursday, April 10, 2025. 
 
The 
pushback against Trump's anti-DEI agenda has extended to European governments and businesses.
 According to a NY Times article from April 2, 2025, American Embassies in several countries sent letters to foreign contractors instructing them to certify their compliance with Trump’s policies aimed at unraveling diversity programs. These letters drew 
sharp reactions from European companies and officials, who see them as part of a broader pressure campaign by the administration to export anti-diversity policies abroad.
 
The European governments and businesses say these demands compromise their deep commitments to DEI, conflict with local laws, and violate international law/treaties.
 
LEGAL INTERPRETATION
The temporary restraining order issued on an emergency basis, applies specifically to the contractor certification requirement under Executive Order #14173. The district court has set the case for expedited briefings and hearings to determine, by the end of April, if the emergency order will be extended during the pendency of the litigation. Even if extended by the district court, this injunction may be appealed by the administration.
 
While this order 
temporarily blocks the Department of Labor from requiring federal contractors to certify their DEI programs
—effectively overriding the 4th Circuit’s stay on that point—it leaves intact the 4th Circuit’s ruling on the other two provisions challenged in the Baltimore case. As a result, the Trump administration may continue canceling “equity-related grants and contracts” and enforcing civil rights laws against so-called “illegal DEI or DEIA practices.”
 
BRIDGE POV
Navigating the fluctuating legal landscape surrounding these EOs, especially the “ping pong” effect of shifting court rulings, requires a strategic and clear-headed approach. 
 
This is further intensified by the administration’s recent directives to European companies, pressuring them to abandon their Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives. In addition to
 igniting significant diplomatic tensions,
 these directives
 pose complex challenges for multinational corporations.
 Rightfully, 
European officials have pushed back forcefully,
 viewing the move as both 
an overreach of US authority, and a violation of their own anti-discrimination laws. 
As a result 
global companies now face a precarious balancing act 
to preserve government contracts while honoring DEI commitments in regions where such principles are 
not only culturally embedded, but legally protected. 
 
The situation underscores the intricate interplay between national policies and international business operations, compelling corporations to reconcile a landscape 
where political dogma and corporate values may be at odds.  
Collaborate with legal counsel and your DEI professionals
 to determine 
compliance obligations while adhering to global values
 and employee expectations
Continue to 
stay informed on legal developments
 - challenges and rulings - related to the Executive Orders. A good understanding of the legal context will allow you to make sound business decisions to 
mitigate risk without compromising business opportunity.
Maintain 
open lines of communication with all stakeholders
 about any evolution to your DEI practice - clearly 
articulate the reason for adjustments while reaffirming a commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace and marketplace
 (actions must align to the commitment)
 
ADDITIONAL RESOURCES
A federal judge temporarily blocks parts of Trump's anti-DEI executive orders | AP News
 
U.S. Seeks to Calm Tempest in Europe Over Trump’s Anti-Diversity Policies - The New York Times
 
 
Chicago Women in Trades v. Trump, et al
. 
MOUNTING RESISTANCE
Mounting resistance to the Trump Administration’s coordinated efforts - through Executive Orders and various Agency actions - to weaponize the rule of law
 
OVERVIEW
Over the past week, leaders in higher education, the legal profession, professional associations and state government officials
 have all publicly condemned the Trump Administration’s efforts to weaponize the rule of law 
- using threats, intimidation, and coercion to pressure institutions and businesses into abandoning DEI initiatives under 
the threat of political retribution, despite no legal requirement to do so. 
 
As the 79 law school deans asserted: “We write to reaffirm basic principles: 
The government should not punish lawyers and law firms for the clients they represent,
 absent specific findings that such representation was illegal or unethical. Punishing lawyers for their representation and advocacy violates the First Amendment and undermines the Sixth Amendment.”
 
There is a divide in the legal community about how to respond to Trump’s efforts to settle scores with political opponents represented by the law firms. Three firms – Perkins Coie, Jenner & Block, and WilmerHale – 
have all sued and successfully gotten court orders to at least partially block the executive orders.
 Wilmer Hale was clear on their position,  “The Executive Order targeting our firm is a 
plainly unlawful attack on the bedrock principles of our nation’s legal system—our clients’ right to counsel and the First Amendment
. The terms of a nearly identical Executive Order have already been enjoined by a federal judge and today we have filed for immediate relief to protect the rights of our clients. We are bringing the dedication, expertise, and values that have served a wide range of clients in matters against administrations of both parties for decades to ensure their and our rights are upheld.” 
 
On April 2, 2025, Perkins Coie filed a motion asking the Court to permanently block enforcement of the unlawful Executive Order targeting our firm: “Since our initial filing, we have made clear our resolve in protecting our firm, safeguarding the interests of our clients, and upholding the rule of law.”
“The Executive Order 
threatens core constitutional principles and freedoms that all Americans hold dear
, and the Court has already found that we are likely to succeed in our challenge.”
 
LEGAL INTERPRETATION
These open letters, along with the legal challenges already filed against the Trump DEI Executive Orders reflect
 a coordinated response  from members of the legal profession - who are sworn to uphold the rule of law 
- against the 
administration’s attempts to weaponize it for political and ideological ends. 
 
This collective action signals 
growing sense of public outrage
 over the administration’s 
coercive tactics and is likely to galvanize broader resistance 
to its ideological agendas and extra-legal demands beyond the federal sector.
 
BRIDGE POV 
An attack on DEI is an attack on business and innovation. Additionally, 
all companies have an obligation to respond to the administration’s attempt to weaponize the rule of law with moral clarity, a principled resolve and a firm commitment to their stated values.
 When the law is weaponized, the private sector becomes not just an economic actor, but a civic one.
Stand on principle not pressure
 - companies should resist politically motivated coercion that demands abandonment of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion or other lawful, values driven practices. Upholding these commitments to ethical governance demonstrates strength and leadership.
Seek legal guidance but don’t hide behind it
 - while staying compliant with the law is essential, companies must recognize the difference between legal obligation and political intimidation.
Collaborate and speak collectively
 - there is power in numbers. Companies don’t have to stand alone - forming coalitions across industries can help dilute risk with strengthening a shared defense of values on a global scale.
EXECUTIVE ORDER # 14253
Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History: Executive Order #14253
 
OVERVIEW
On March 27, 2025, Trump signed an executive order titled: "Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History." This directive 
mandates the removal of what it terms “improper, divisive or anti-American ideology” from federal institutions, notably targeting the Smithsonian institution. 
 
The Executive Order accuses prior Administrations of using public monuments, museums, and other public sites, dedicated to memorializing the country’s true history, of promoting  a “corrosive ideology” that it claims distorts history by portraying America’s founding as “inherently racist, sexist, oppressive, or otherwise irredeemably flawed.” 
 
The Order cites examples where racism, sexism or transgender historical figures are acknowledged and directs those overseeing these spaces to remove such narratives and instead  “honor the richness of American history and innovation,” and “instill pride in the hearts of all Americans.”
 
This move follows Trump's broader push to exert sweeping controls over cultural institutions, such as the Kennedy Center - undermining their ability to serve the public interest and fulfill their mission to advance art and history. 
 
LEGAL INTERPRETATION
This Executive Order 
echoes the anti-CRT movement 
launched by Christopher Rufo in 2020, which led to federal and state actions like Trump’s anti-DEI training order and Florida’s Stop-WOKE Act. These efforts 
aimed to suppress discussions of racism, sexism, and structural inequality in education and the workplace.
 
Critics further argue that this executive order 
effectively seeks to erase significant aspects of American history by downplaying or eliminating narratives related to slavery, segregation, and systemic racism.
 By promoting a more “patriotic” and less critical portrayal of the nation’s past, the order is seen as 
an attempt to whitewash history and suppress discussions on the complexities and struggles that have shaped the United States.  
 
This move has also sparked concerns 
among historians and civil rights advocates, who view it as an effort to control cultural narratives and diminish the recognition of marginalized communities’ contributions to American history. 
 
Because the Order targets federally-owned spaces under direct presidential control, 
legal challenges are unlikely to succeed.
 However, 
Congress retains oversight authority and could scrutinize any actions
 taken under the Order to ensure alignment with public interest and statutory mandates.
 
BRIDGE POV 
​​This is when the 
private sector and other civic actors must step in to fill the growing void in our collective national narrative
. As the
 federal government moves to erase or obscure the histories of marginalized communities
, businesses, philanthropic organizations, media platforms and others have an opportunity—indeed, 
a responsibility — to preserve and amplify these stories. 
 
Truth in history is not just a moral imperative, it is foundational to a functioning democracy
. A society that cannot confront its past cannot create a rich future.
 
In moments when the state retreats from this truth, civic society must step forward—
not just to resist erasure, but to actively shape a more honest, representative, and resilient national story.
 
The private sector must
 not remain neutral in this moment
 - their 
obligation is to their employees and consumers, many of whom are witnessing their histories erased 
through the dismantling of narratives, monuments, artworks and more
Support museums, archives, universities and grassroots organizations 
committed to telling the full story of American history
, including the experiences of marginalized communities. Strategic philanthropy can preserve this important part of our foundation and help institutions remain resilient in the face of political pressure.
Integrate inclusive storytelling into your brand platforms 
- use advertising, content marketing, social media and internal communications to elevate the historical narrative of underrepresented communities. Work with your DEI practitioners to ensure authentic representation and the avoidance of stereotypes.
Continue
 investing in historically grounded education of factual contextual history
 to ensure the workforce becomes a 
living archive of inclusive knowledge
 
ADDITIONAL RESOURCES
Historians Defend the Smithsonian - AHA
COMMUNITY EVENTS
BRIDGE invites everyone to join for our 
monthly Community Calls
 which take place on the last Thursday of every month, gathering DEI marketing, and business leaders committed to driving systemic change within our organizations and the industry at large.
 
Our next call is 
Thursday, April 24th from 12-1p ET
.
ADD CALL TO CALENDAR
 
BRIDGE25: FORWARD
, our annual 2 1/2 day retreat will convene close to 200 of the top DEI, Marketing & Business Leaders at the stunning Seabird Resort overlooking the beach in 
Oceanside, CA, May 4-6.
Our commitment is to deliver and experience that will be 
unapologetically indelible, determined and audacious!
 
 
Spots are limited so please don't wait to sign up!
REQUEST AN INVITE
 
 
­ 
 
­ 
 
 
BRIDGE
1276 Auto Park Way Suite D, PMB 183, Escondido, CA 92029

subject: Access to Capital April Newsletter
body:
APRIL NEW﻿SLETTER
Latest News
 
 
 
JOIN WBDC FOR COOK COUNTY SOURCE WEBINAR SERIES
 
WBDC X THE COOK COUNTY SOURCE WEBINAR SERIES
WBDC has partnered with the Cook County Small Business Source to provide monthly webinars on a variety of important topics. Join us for our upcoming installment on Thursday, April 24 from 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM CST via Zoom.
 
 
Irene Schild Caminer, Caminer Law, LLC.
 
 
Estate Planning Protection: Leave Nothing To Chance
Estate planning isn’t just for the wealthy; it’s for anyone who wants to protect their loved ones and ensure their wishes are honored. Grab this chance to hear Irene Caminer, of Caminer Law, LLC, present the essential elements of estate planning, debunk common misconceptions, and show why a plan provides security, clarity, and peace of mind. Don't let courts decide what happens to your assets, your family’s future, and even you! Don’t leave your future to chance—take control today!
Register Here
 
LINE UP for Success
 
 
 
Entrepreneur Networking Forum a Success
WBDC partnered with YWCA Breedlove Entrepreneurship Center for an entrepreneurial networking session, LINE Up for Success, on Friday, February 28th at The Study at University of Chicago. Sponsored by The Coleman Foundation, the event featured keynote addresses from Marquis Miller of the Obama Foundation and Chrishon Lampley of Love Cork Screw, Inc. Associate Director Denea Beale lent the event her planning and panel moderating skills. Denea was accompanied by Associate Director Emma Westfall and Director of Strategic Partnerships Zabdiel Ek on the day of the event. Attendees benefitted from expert-led break out sessions, networking opportunities and vendor fair. 
﻿
Be sure to join our Facebook community and view our upcoming events below to participate in future events with WBDC!
 
 
CLIENT SPOTLIGHT
 
Natalie Hammoud, Owner, Skin Bar and Studio
The Access to Capital team is proud to spotlight client Natalie Hammoud, Owner of Skin Bar and Studio. 
Natalie created Skin Bar and Studio, located in the Old Town neighborhood of Chicago, with a dream to inspire a new kind of self-care—where luxury feels personal, and every moment is thoughtfully designed just for you. Read about what inspired Natalie and how WBDC assisted in her opening her brick and mortar this winter. 
"During the pandemic, I realized the importance of slowing down and investing in oneself. I envisioned a lavish escape rooted in real results—a space where skincare isn’t just a routine but a truly uplifting experience. From the aesthetic to the treatments, it’s all crafted to feel effortless, elevated, and entirely unforgettable. At Skin Bar and Studio, we invite you to indulge, unwind, and discover a radiant, more confident you. Working with the Women’s Business Development Center has been an incredible experience on my journey as an entrepreneur. Their support, guidance, and resources have been invaluable in helping me launch and grow my med spa, Skin Bar and Studio. From business planning to networking opportunities, they provided me with the tools and confidence needed to navigate the challenges of entrepreneurship. I am truly grateful for their dedication to empowering women-owned businesses and fostering a community of support. My experience with them has been both inspiring and transformative, and I highly recommend their services to any woman looking to build a successful business."
Learn More About  Skin Bar and Studio
 
 
UPCOMING EVENTS
 
Wednesday, April 9
The KIVA Hour 
10:00 AM - 11:00 AM CST
Virtual
Is Kiva a capital option for me and my business? Discover how you can leverage Kiva to fuel your dreams, whether you’re starting a business or growing your business. We’ll walk through the eligibility criteria, application requirements, and the various ways you can utilize Kiva. Plus, get inspired by success stories from those who’ve transformed their aspirations into reality with Kiva’s support. Don’t miss this chance to learn how to navigate the world of zero-interest borrowing. Register now!
Register Here
 
 
 
Tuesday, April 22
Direct Lending Program Information Session 
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM CST 
Virtual
Securing capital may be an important step in fueling your business' growth. The Access to Capital team is holding an information session on the Direct Lending Program, an alternative capital option for good businesses and owners with less-than-perfect credit history. Join us for an informational webinar to learn more about the Direct Lending Program, borrower eligibility and other requirements.
Register Here
 
 
 
 
Thursday, April 24
Estate Planning Protection: Leave Nothing To Chance
10:00 AM - 11:00 AM CST 
Virtual
Estate planning isn’t just for the wealthy; it’s for anyone who wants to protect their loved ones and ensure their wishes are honored. Grab this chance to hear Irene Caminer, of Caminer Law, LLC, present the essential elements of estate planning, debunk common misconceptions, and show why a plan provides security, clarity, and peace of mind. Don't let courts decide what happens to your assets, your family’s future, and even you! Don’t leave your future to chance—take control today!
Regsiter Here
 
 
 
 
 
﻿Access to Capital Community
 
 
 
Request To Join Our Facebook Group
Staying informed and engaged on all things capital has never been easier! Request to join our Access to Capital Community on Facebook where we share news, insights, tips, upcoming events, and thoughtful conversation prompts. Engaging in our Access to Capital Community is like having a coffee chat with friends who really get the financial struggles of running a business! Create real connections with local entrepreneurs. Join us today!
Join Access to Capital Community on Facebook
 
 
 
1:1 Business Advising
 
 
No Cost, One-on-one, Business Advising
The Access to Capital team can guide small business owners to optimal funding options during one-on-one advising sessions. By analyzing financial needs, advisors can help owners access the right type of capital, from the right source, at the right time.
Schedule an Advising Session
 
 
 
 
Grant Opportunities
 
 
Small Business Capital and Infrastructure Grant Program
Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity is offering a grant opportunity to businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals (SEDI) or very small businesses (VSBs)1 to support small business capital improvement projects. This program will offer small business grants across the state to help eligible businesses achieve sustainable growth, improve efficiency, and create and retain jobs. To promote equitable economic recovery and growth, businesses located in Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) Investment Areas will be prioritized. These businesses are uniquely positioned to benefit from investments that address the needs of economically disadvantaged communities. Projects that focus on job creation, economic revitalization, or increased community engagement in these areas will receive additional points during the review process.
Applications are open through April 7, 2025.
Learn More Here

subject: Welcome Sarah!
body:
Hi all,
Please join me in welcoming Sarah Jordan to the team of part-time folks that help make LCW run smoothly!
Sarah is based in Ohio, has a background in global cultures, and we used to work together some time ago 🙂.
Sarah will be assisting with Kaitlin's tasks when she goes on maternity leave & will be helping with a few other operational tasks. You'll get to meet her on our next all staff.
Welcome Sarah!
Nicole Barile

subject: Fw: Recommendation to write about Alisa Kolodizner
body:
Alisa,

A few days ago, I received an anonymous submission saying I should reach out about ghostwriting your biography. I'm a writer out of Texas. 

Submission details: 
Name: Alisa Kolodizner
Please tell us about your project: Alisa has an incredible life story that needs to be turned into a book.

Would love to schedule a quick call on Wednesday to explore this further.

Looking forward to connecting.

If you think I got the wrong person, please let me know.

All the best,
Taylor R.

Sent from my iPhone

subject: Connect with your market! Online resources!
body:
Digital/Online Marketing Tools
for Beginners
Thursday, April 10, 2025, 11am to 1:30pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
You must attend the webinar to receive the recording and slides.
Identify and Reach Your Market Niche!
 
Social media and digital marketing tools are an essential part of your marketing strategy, whether you are targeting other businesses or individual customers.
Let an experienced marketing and sales professional walk you through how to find and use the digital and social media resources that will help you successfully speak to your real market.
Great Q&A opportunities!
At the end of this webinar, you will have the resources and knowledge to:
List practical ways to increase sales, using targeted marketing strategies 
Summarize steps to increase your visibility on social media  
Describe how competitive research can position you more favorably  
Discuss tactics and steps to proactively prospect for new clients, with an emphasis on digital and social media      
Learn how to use Artificial Intelligence to allow you to perform multiple marketing tactics more efficiently and effectively.
Listen to what others have said about this presentation:
“Very informative and insightful. Tim was an authoritative and captivating speaker.“
“Tim was concise and informative. He spoke well and made it relatable and understandable. Definitely had some take aways from this session that will help me move my company forward”
“AI [Artificial Intelligence] information was helpful. Learning about SEO tools was great!”
Your Host & Speaker
﻿
Tim Contado
Tim Contado i
s a sales and marketing
professional with more than 25 years
of integrated marketing and sales
experience in Rubbermaid, Little Tikes,
Nestle, and several startups and private
companies. Tim has been a SCORE
﻿
mentor since Sept. 2016.
 
 
REGISTER
 
This webinar is brought to you for free
﻿through the generosity of a donor who wishes to remain anonymous.
 
﻿

subject: Alisa, Join Us for a Look Back & Leap Forward: Workplace Agility to AI Fundamentals
body:
Discover how past insights and future innovations converge on May 15th. Secure your spot today!
 
 
Connect With Great Minds: 
ELE Community 
  
🌟 Exploring Workplace Agility in the AI Era 🌟
at ELE's Milwaukee Talent Conference – Join Us!
Alisa, 
  
We are preparing for the exciting 
Milwaukee Talent Development Conference 2025 @ Manpower
 on May 15, 2025
. Let's take a moment to reflect on how far we've come and where we're headed.
  
Throwback Thursday to 2005
—
Workplace Agility
Fast forward to 2025
—
in the AI Era
We convened an influential panel of CLOs from prominent organizations like BCBS, Motorola, and UL nearly two decades ago at one of our earlier annual conferences. They discussed critical issues like workplace agility and leadership gaps, which remain incredibly relevant today. 
 
As we look forward to another enriching conference, we are thrilled to announce that 
Jane Shales
, one of the insightful panelists from our 2005 event, will join us again. Her return marks a full circle in our journey toward fostering exemplary leadership and innovation.
 
Several other ELE founding and new contributors will also be part of the program on May 15th:
In 2011, 
Suzanne Sherry
’s CHRO with JCI was a Keynote Speaker at ELE’s first Milwaukee Talent Conference hosted at Harley-Davison. This year, she’s partnering with 
Angie Zeigler
 to launch the 
HR LEADer Hub. 
She will help me open the conference by introducing  
Syneathia LaGrant
, Head of Global Talent and Capabilities at Manpower.
In 2008, 
Amy Leschke Kahle
 hosted ELE’s first Milwaukee event while serving as L&D Director at Kohl’s. On May 15th, she returns as a keynote speaker, teaming up with  
Janice Simmons
, CLO at Froedtert ThedaCare, for 
Myth Spotting and Myth Busting
.
Back in 2002, 
Angelica Stilling
 helped organize ELE’s first conference—right after landing her first HR role at Baxter. On May 15th, she'll share her Talent Management expertise on 
Harnessing Data to Enhance Talent Development and Elevate Employee Experience 
alongside 
Ashanti Morgan
 and 
Ben Warner
. 
 
Why Attend?
 
Practical Insights:
 Gain actionable strategies from real-world case studies.
Expert Speakers:
 Hear from industry leaders and innovators.
Networking Opportunities:
 Connect with fellow HR professionals and share best practices.
CHECK YOUR REGISTRATION
 
AI Practical Lab Feature: Create, Iterate, Elevate - Partnering with AI in Your Work
  
To give you a preview, our AI Practical Lab series invites you to experiment safely with real-world applications of artificial intelligence in talent development. Pictured here is one of the dynamic concurrent sessions planned for May 15th.
 
During this concurrent breakout, you'll have the opportunity to engage in hands-on activities and discover practical, repeatable processes for integrating AI that can significantly impact your business strategies.
READY TO INSPIRE? 
SHARE YOUR PERSPECTIVES
—Explore new dimensions of workforce agility, embrace AI, and enhance our strategic acumen.
 
Join us at Manpower, a hub for global workforce innovation, for a day of transformative learning and networking.
Milwaukee Talent Development Conference 2025 @ Manpower: Workplace Agility in the AI Era
Explore the working 
Agenda 
& 
 Attendee List
 to secure your spot!
Connect with
 
 
Dirk Tussing
 
immediately to discuss potential speaking engagements. Don't miss this chance to share your expertise and shape the conversation.
The Power Of ELE
Want to understand the power of ELE’s collective intelligence with forward-thinking peers?
Schedule a walk-through
 
 
 
 
 
 
Access Our On-Demand Talent Solutions
Our 
ELE Insights
 lets you learn on-demand from your peers either on your computer or mobile devices. Slides, podcasts, videos and more! Here are links to the four most recent events with post-sharing multimedia recordings.
The Future is Now: Transforming L&D for Tomorrow's Challenges
Developing Skills and Attributes for a Dynamic Workforce
✨ AI Practical Lab: Onboarding AI as a New Hire
Strategic Re-skilling: Explore How AI is Transforming Workforce Capabilities
 
UPCOMING EVENTS & LIVE DISCUSSIONS
These sessions feature experts sharing the latest research and insights on navigating leadership challenges, leveraging AI, and boosting retention
. 
Register now
 
to secure your spot!
 
Explore Upcoming Events | Fresh Ideas & Discussions
 
 
SECURE YOUR SPOT for ELE's Chicagoland Quarterly Cohort Exchanges!
     
April 29: 
Learning Outside the Box for Upskilling @ The Art Institute of Chicago
Don’t miss this chance to redefine traditional learning approaches by integrating the arts into executive training.
 
This event is set in the Ryan Learning Center, the museum’s hub for learning and creativity, offering a blend of art and interactive experiences to enrich your understanding.
 
Why Invest Your Time and Energy in ELE?
Stay Ahead of the Curve:
 ELE’s hybrid shift is a strategic breakthrough that aligns with the future of work. Gain insights from our community to stay ahead of talent development trends.
Expand Your Network: 
Connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build a network that transcends borders. The power of collaboration within our trusted community is limitless.
Get Practical Tips and Tools:
 Receive actionable takeaways for enhancing your talent development initiatives. ELE’s journey provides practical tips and tools for immediate implementation.
WE’RE ALWAYS READY TO ANSWER.
Questions? Please contact 
help@ele.llc
 or 
book time with me
.
Our goal is to exceed your expectations with our Brand Promise.
Connect and Share for Stronger Business Impact
Learn new skills and explore talent development capabilities through ELE’s HR platform of peer-shared insights, for improved business performance.

 - Connect With Great Minds

subject: Alisa Kolodizner to feature as Influential DEI & Strategic Business Consultant of the Year, 2025
body:
Hi 
Alisa
,
I’m Kevin Brown, Business Development Manager at 
CIO Global
.
 
Visionary Leaders are forging ahead in all business sectors, consistently shattering barriers, and establishing new standards for their peers. By celebrating and amplifying the accomplishments of these leaders, we help in fostering a culture that not only values but also uplifts them in the business world. This is not just an award or a title; it’s a testament to the grit, talent, and unwavering commitment of leaders in business around the globe. It is designed to acknowledge and appreciate these leaders for their unique vision, their trials and tribulations, and their journey to the top.
 
CIO Global
 
is delighted to extend an invitation to 
Alisa Kolodizner 
to
 
feature as 
Influential DEI & Strategic Business Consultant of the Year, 2025.
 
Through this 
special feature
, we will highlight 
your success story, leadership abilities, expertise, innovative thinking, creative flair, inventiveness, distinctive value proposition, and the path to achieving success
.
 
*This unique feature guarantees that the entire space is dedicated solely to you.
Our Offerings:
 
Special Feature Benefits
1.     Ten (10) full pages profile
2.     Image on Front Cover Page
3.     Profile link | Web link | Digital link
4.     
Award
 logo
5.     Digital Badge | Digital Certificate
6.     SEO optimized article | Social Media Promotion
7.     Videos/Podcast promotion on our website
8.     One Page Ad x 1 
9.     Link to your Website & Social Media
 
Package Price
: $850 USD.
 
Please let me know if you would be interested to participate in this edition so that we can discuss further process.
 
I look forward to hearing back from you.
 
Best Regards,
Kevin Brown | CIO Global
Business Development Manager
Email
: 
kevin@thecioglobal.com

subject: Master Cash Flow & Budgeting – Your Business Depends on It
body:
From Budgeting to Cash Flow Management
Wednesday, April 16, 2025, 2pm to 4pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
Can't make the live webinar?
﻿Register anyway and we'll send you the recording.
Knowing your business’s cash flow helps you prepare for the 
future and possible new business cycles.
﻿It lets you see how much cash you have to fund your growth.
This session discusses the budgeting and cash management processes, techniques and tips you need to get a handle on your business's financial future.
 
Small business funding expert Ron Dooley will walk you through ways to build on your business’s success by creating budgeting, bookkeeping and cash flow systems that can help you do just that.
At the end of this webinar, you will have the knowledge and resources to:
Use the data your business already produces to drive better outcomes
Describe the importance of both profits and cash flow
Budget and manage the outflow of funds to strengthen your business  
Develop other tools to protect and use your business’s cash
Find the right financial professionals to help you as needed
 
 
Instructor:
Ron Dooley
Financial Executive with 30+ years 
of executive-level banking, consulting 
and private equity experience; 
﻿
expertise advising companies on turnaround and restructuring efforts.
 
REGISTER
 
THIS IS A PAID EVENT
 
﻿

subject: News Alert: Notifying members of privacy incident
body:
Get the details
BLUE VISION
SM
News for Employer Groups
April 3, 2025
NEWS ALERT
BCBSIL to Notify Members of Blue Access for Members
SM
/Well onTarget
®
 Privacy Incident
Applies to all groups, Medicare
Our vendor of Well onTarget
®
 recently notified us about unusual registration activity via Blue Access for Members
SM
. BAM
SM
 is the portal system through which individuals can access information about their membership.
Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois’s investigation detected suspicious activity impacting certain BAM registrations. This activity may have caused potential disclosure of some member information between Nov. 8, 2024, and March 5, 2025.
BCBSIL deactivated certain BAM accounts, temporarily suspended online creation of new BAM accounts and blocked access to and from WoT
®
 via BAM.
The investigation is ongoing. However, we have confirmed that this is a privacy incident. We will be offering one year of free identity protection services to impacted individuals.
What you need to know: BCBSIL will be sending a 
notification letter
 
 to affected members beginning April 11. Customer Service teams will have FAQs about the incident to address member questions about the incident or the letter.
Please reach out to your BCBSIL account representative if you have questions.

subject: RESEND: Accelerate Your Entrepreneurial Journey
body:
Acquire shared wisdom and practical strategies from those who’ve walked your path
 
 
Journey to Success: 
Shared Wisdom, Proven Strategies
 
Every entrepreneur’s path is unique, filled with challenges, breakthroughs, and defining moments. Journey to Success is your opportunity to learn from those who’ve walked the road before you—seasoned experts and ambitious peers who are shaping the future of business.
This interactive event is designed to help you gain practical strategies, new perspectives, and meaningful connections that will fuel your entrepreneurial growth.
Thursday, April 17
@4:00-7:00 PM ET 
BKLYN Commons
495 Flatbush Ave, Brooklyn, NY 
Register Now
 
The event is free. You must register to attend.
Select your TWO topics of interest when you register.
 
NYWIB is 100% volunteer and communities like ours matter more than ever. Help support our free programming. 
Donations of even $10 are welcome and appreciated, but not required. 
﻿
CLICK
 here if you care to make a donation.﻿
WHAT TO EXPECT
4:00-5:00pm
 
1:1 MENTORING WITH SCORE 
Meet with a certified SCORE mentor to talk about your specific business challenges. 
 
5:00-7:00pm
 
GUIDED DISCUSSION CIRCLES (Pick TWO when you register) 
Participate in TWO small group discussions that align with your biggest business challenges; engage in experience-driven conversations with industry experts and peers
·
      
Funding & Access to Capital
·
      
Branding & Marketing Mastery
·
      
Wellness, Self-Care, Time Management for Entrepreneurs
·
      
Business Foundations

subject: We want to hear from more of you!
body:
Anonymous Survey
Dear Friend of SCORE:
We are sending this anonymous survey AGAIN. If you've already responded, thank you. If you haven't, this is your chance to help us improve your experience with SCORE.
﻿At this time, the New York City SCORE Chapter is embarking on a project to raise funds from foundations and corporations to assist us in continuing to provide quality mentoring programs and workshops to the many clients we serve. The purpose of this questionnaire, which should only take a few minutes to complete, is to gather demographic and other information about our current and past clients that is often requested by potential funders.
It would be greatly appreciated if you would fill in the answers below that most closely relate to your involvement with SCORE New York City and finish the survey as soon as possible. We reopened this survey because we need higher participation.
In advance, thank you for helping us better serve the greater New York City community. Please be assured that your answers to this survey are completely anonymous. Feel free to skip any questions that you prefer not to answer.
Let's go!

1120 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036

subject: Re: Weekly accounting update 4/2/25
body:
Thanks so much SG. I'll take September! Hoping some of those pending SOWs get signed soon & some new biz comes in. Appreciate it. And noted on your vacay. Sounds like a plan!
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 4:47 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Weekly accounting update 4/2/25
 
 
Hi Team, attached are this week’s reports. 
 
I accounted for all of the prepaid expenses we put through recently, and updated projected invoicing from Scoro with SOW’s that are signed or in progress. 
SOW’s that aren’t signed yet (and deliverables on active SOW’s that aren’t scheduled yet) are NOT reflected so 
those will be additional revenue
.
 
Without additional revenue we will start operating at a loss in June, and the line of concern is in the middle of September. I expect this line to keep getting pushed as time goes on and more invoicing gets planned, barring major expenses that I don’t know about.
 
Regarding my upcoming vacation:
 
I leave next Wednesday the 9
th
, and I’ll be here briefly in the morning and then offline for the rest of the week. 
My plan is to schedule the PPF before I leave, to run automatically on the 14
th
. 
I will try to check my email and Teams every couple of days, and stay on top of new invoicing and any urgent questions/requests. I’ll also try to do a forecast update for you sometime around the 16
th
-18th, I think we’ll have a chill day or two in there. I will not be available for any meetings.
I’ll be back home and working on Monday the 28
th
, and will prioritize the EOM PPF first, then catching up on email.
 
Hope the rest of the week goes great!
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW
Email: 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 
I will be traveling April 9
th
 through 25
th
 with limited access to email.

subject: WP Engine wins Gold Stevie Award for customer service excellence
body:
A gold standard in customer support 
WP Engine’s Customer Experience team earns top honors at this year’s Stevie Awards.
 
Find Out More Here 
 
A HISTORY OF EXCELLENCE IN SERVICE
Recognized leadership in customer support 
At WP Engine, customer satisfaction is more than a goal—it’s a driving force. That’s why we’re proud to announce that our Customer Experience (CX) team has earned the prestigious 
Gold Stevie Award
 for Customer Service Department of the Year in the Computer Services category! 
 
This incredible honor marks another major achievement in our long-standing history of excellence in customer service. Since 2015, WP Engine has won more than a dozen Stevie Awards, and our CX team is at the heart of this success. Continually setting the bar for exceptional support, their tireless dedication ensures that every customer experience is 
Customer-Inspired
. 
 
Here’s why this recognition is so special: 
Marks our 11th Stevie Award for customer support and our 15th Stevie Award overall
Highlights over a decade of consistent achievement at The Stevie Awards
Underscores the dedication and commitment of our incredible support agents  
Thank you to our amazing CX team and customers for making this possible. Let’s keep raising the bar together! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St, #1000, Austin,TX 78701

The Exchange 2025: Next Week – Secure Your Spot!
 
Time is running out! 
The Exchange 2025 is happening NEXT WEEK
 on 
April 10 at Soldier Field
—and tickets are still available! Don’t miss your chance to be part of the Chicagoland Chamber’s
 largest networking event of the year
, presented by 
Southwest Airlines.
 
Here are four reasons why you won’t want to miss out:
 
1. Unmatched Networking Potential
With over 100 exhibitors and hundreds of attendees, this is the place to be if you’re looking to make meaningful connections. Our 
Speed Networking by LinkedIn
 sessions will help you quickly meet potential clients, partners, and industry leaders, ensuring you get the most out of your time at the event.
 
2. Learn from Industry Experts
Take part in 
Chamber Chats
—interactive, 20-minute sessions led by top experts. This year’s topics cover pressing issues like talent trends and affordable small business health insurance, designed to help you stay ahead in today’s fast-moving business world.
 
3. Savor Chicago’s Best Flavors
Indulge in the 
Culinary Showcase by Grubhub
, where you can sample delicious bites from Chicago’s top restaurants. Whether you’re a foodie or just love great cuisine, this is the perfect chance to enjoy local favorites and sip on complimentary beverages as you network.
 
4. Experience Soldier Field
The Exchange 2025 isn’t just about business—it’s about experiencing the legendary Soldier Field. Explore exclusive club spaces and take in the rich history and atmosphere of this iconic venue while you connect and learn!
 
Special Offer: Buy 3 Tickets, Get 1 Free!
For a limited time, when you buy three tickets, you’ll receive a fourth one at no extra cost! It’s the perfect opportunity to bring along your colleagues or business partners. Don’t wait!
The Exchange 2025 is one event you won’t want to miss. Reserve your tickets today, and get ready to 
connect, learn, and grow
 at Soldier Field on April 10!

subject: Plan, Grow, Succeed: Master Your Business Financials!
body:
Do Your Financial Projections!
Wednesday, April 9, 2025, 1pm to 3pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
You must attend the webinar to receive the recording and slides.
 
Build a solid foundation for your business.
 
﻿
Financial projections help you assess the profitability of your business, prepare for future events and access the resources you need for future growth and a healthy bottom line.
Two experienced SCORE NYC Mentors will take you through four forecasting fundamentals that will make your projections a success!
They will share case studies to show you how the process works!
At the end of this session, you will have the resources and knowledge to:
Summarize 4 forecasting fundamentals: Business Plan Basics, Importance of Stating Assumptions, Sales Forecast Preparation, and Assembling a Profit and Loss Statement ready to show to investors and/or lenders 
Describe the assembling of financial projections based on the examples of two small startup businesses 
Utilize the relevant Financial Planning templates and tools 
Recap the 6 key criteria that lenders are looking for
 
 
Your Speaker:
Jerry Baron
Owned financial consulting firm; 
expert in business plan 
development, working with 
startups and nonprofits. 
﻿SCORE NYC Mentor.
 
 
Your Speaker:
Sandy Eames
Marketing and business 
development executive, 
consultant with expertise 
in business plans development. 
﻿SCORE NYC Mentor.

a donor who wishes to remain anonymous.

subject: Re: Question - Alisa
body:
Hi Alisa,
I hope you’re feeling great. I emailed you last week about saving $600-800 per employee on payroll taxes, and I decided to follow up with some details. Our PCMP program at BrightPath—used by over 70,000 employees at McDonald’s, FedEx, and Hilton—offers:

 * $600-800/year per employee (e.g., $147,000 for 210 employees)
 * No changes to your current benefits
 * Zero upfront fees
 * Completely IRS-compliant

I’d be glad to a tailored savings breakdown for Lcw. How does Wednesday at 11 AM work for a 15-minute call?

Best,
Graham Lee 
Strategic Account Executive
BrightPath Group

On Thu, March 27, 2025 5:17 PM, Graham Lee 

[graham.lee@renclds.info]> wrote:

> Hey Alisa,
> If we could help Lcw to reduce payroll taxes by ~$700/year per employee, putting this money back to the business every payroll cycle, would it be worth a 10min chat?
> 
> Let me know Alisa.
> 
> Best regards,
> Graham Lee
> Strategic Account Executive
> BrightPath Group
>

subject: Re: Russian Fluency + Pipeline Visibility
body:
Hey Alisa,

Did you get a chance to look over my first email?

Just like how LCW fosters equity and inclusion across diverse organizations, Proshort fosters optimal sales performance through AI-driven insights and personalized coaching for diverse teams.

Basically, Proshort.ai's tool can analyze all your sales data and give your sales team actionable insights on precisely what to do to close more opportunities.

It’s similar to ChatGPT, but for your sales data!

On average, we help our clients close more deals by 15%.

Open to learning more?

Sincerely,
Lauren Mitchell
SDR
Proshort | Cupertino, CA
 

Not into this? Reply ‘unsubscribe’ and we’ll break up—it’s not you, it’s us.

On Wed, March 26, 2025 5:13 PM, Lauren Mitchell 

[lauren.m@getobtarget.info]> wrote:

> Hi Alisa,
> 
> Saw on LinkedIn that you speak Russian. I’ve heard that “как дела?” holds a deeper meaning than just a greeting, sharing genuine care. Have you practiced it lately?
> 
> That said, if we could help you boost your close rates, would that be something you'd be open to?
> 
> Proshort's AI tool can process all your sales data and give your sales reps actionable insights on exactly what to do to close more opportunities.
> 
> For example, we can help you get answers to questions like:
> 
> - What key resistance do clients express regarding inclusivity outcomes when discussing transformational organizational development to address diverse workplace cultures? - How do sales insights from past DEI projects impact proposals for client organizations seeking long-term sustainable practices in varied cultural contexts?  
> 
> It’s similar to ChatGPT, but for your sales data!
> 
> Worth a short chat?
> 
> All the best,
> Lauren Mitchell
> SDR
> Proshort | Cupertino, CA
>  
> 
> If you’re over it, reply “unsubscribe” and I’ll disappear quicker than a coworker at 4:59 PM on a Friday.
>

subject: Master Your Pitch—Join This Must-Attend Workshop!
body:
Pitching to Investors
Friday, April 4, 2025, 1pm to 4:30pm Eastern Time
In-person workshop in midtown Manhattan
Reserve My Spot
 
Persuading Investors is an Art 
AND
 a Science!
Presenting yourself to prospective investors 
﻿
can be key to funding success.
An effective pitch enhances your credibility and your chances of getting the resources you need to fuel your business.
 
Find out the key elements of an effective pitch and how to deliver a story that resonates. 
You’ll have an opportunity to practice your pitch and get real-time feedback.
At the end of this workshop, you will have the knowledge and resources to
: 
Differentiate between pitching to buyers and investors 
Identify the objectives of a compelling pitch 
Outline the key components of your company’s pitch 
Craft messaging that tells a compelling investor story 
Design investor outreach tailored to your company 
Deliver your pitch and handle investor Q&A effectively 
 
 
Speaker: Carolyn Katz
Former venture capital investor 
and small business owner; expert 
on startup and small business 
funding and preparation of investor 
and pitch materials; frequent webinar presenter on small business loans 
﻿
and other funding options.
 
 
REGISTER
 
This is a PAID, IN-PERSON workshop and will not be recorded.
﻿

I-CASH
Bright Start 529
IL ABLE
Treasurer’s Note
April 2, 2025
Tips for Fighting Computer Scammers
Last month, I was working on two separate laptops on different projects when I noticed one was flooded with announcements. Your computer has been compromised! Russians are trying to access your files! You have downloaded seven viruses!
I wasn’t sure what I had done to cause this, but rather than click any buttons or links or call the phone number I was instructed to call, I called our office’s head of information technology.
He was able to determine that no information was lost, no files were stolen, and no money went missing because we had good protections in place, took quick action, and didn’t fall for the scammers’ tricks. Most people don’t have an IT department with cybersecurity professionals on call, however.
This point was driven home to me a couple of weeks later when a senior citizen told me a similar story, but with a far more expensive outcome.
She told me how embarrassed she was and how stupid she felt for falling for the scam. But she wanted me to share some details with you so that others don’t fall for the same trap.
Like me, she received pop-up notifications on her computer, telling her that someone was attacking her bank account and giving her a phone number to call.
Here is a screenshot of an actual security scam that can pop up out of nowhere when you are browsing the internet.
The scammers on the other end were very professional. After telling her that her bank account was indeed under attack, they asked her if she knew the phone number to her bank branch. She didn’t.
That was OK because they offered to transfer her. By now, it is obvious to you that she didn’t speak to anyone from her bank. But to her, it all sounded very official. Even though she had some concerns, they had plausible answers to every question she raised.
They relied on pressure and timelines to keep her on the phone as she drove to her bank to withdraw funds. They gave her excuses to give if the bank tellers asked why she was withdrawing so much cash. They had reasons why people at the bank branch couldn’t be trusted: The attack might be coming from inside the bank.
In hindsight, she sees several of the warning signs, but the people on the phone sounded very knowledgeable. She trusted them.
She doesn’t know how she was targeted, but she was a good target because she was a recent widow. Her husband had dealt with money matters, and much of this was new to her.
Older people often are victimized by scammers. A recent 
AARP article
 states, “Losses from scams reported by Americans over age 60 were up 11 percent [in 2023] over the year before, according to the FBI’s Elder Fraud Report, with fraud criminals stealing more than $3.4 billion from older Americans in 2023.”
If you haven’t been targeted by a scam like the one I described, chances are pretty good that you have received text messages about unpaid tolls or other such scams.
It broke my heart to hear her story. I felt physical pain and nausea as she detailed the various steps she was directed through and the amount of money that is now gone, unlikely to ever be returned to her.
I don’t ever want to hear another story like this. Scams like this rely on urgency and fear to manipulate victims. I asked our IT Department for some tips.
Red flags to Watch for
: 
Unsolicited pop-ups
: Legitimate security alerts will never appear through random browser pop-ups.
Urgent phone calls or emails
: Microsoft and other reputable companies do not call users about security threats.
Requests for remote access
: No genuine tech support will ask for access to your computer unless you initiated the request through official channels.
Pressure to make payments
: Scammers will often insist that you transfer money immediately to “protect” your assets.
How to Protect Yourself
:
Close the pop-up
: Do not interact with it. Close the browser using Task Manager (Ctrl + Shift + Esc) if necessary.
Run a real scan
: Open your legitimate security software and run a scan for malware.
Never call random numbers
: Always verify customer support contacts directly from the company’s official website.
Report the scam
: If you come across a fraudulent alert, report it to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and your local authorities.
Other Resources
:
Federal Trade Commission Consumer Advice
 
Sign Up for Federal Trade Commission Consumer Alerts
Illinois Attorney General’s Office Senior Advocacy
 
Many of us think that we could never fall for a similar scam. However, with new technologies, AI, and deep fake voice creation, these scammers have more professional tools to fool more people. We hope to provide you a few tools to fight back.
Sincerely,
Michael
 
Welcome to "The Mailbag," which is your opportunity to ask me about topics like our programs, other state government functions, or anything else that interests you.
Q.
 
You may bleed blue and orange. In our home, we bleed maroon and gold for Loyola University of Chicago. It may be that Loyola didn't make the NCAA tournament. However, they are still playing in the NIT. There is an Illinois team to cheer for postseason. 
—
Kathy W.
A.
 I received several comments like this after 
writing about 
the Illini men’s basketball team in the postseason. Although I love the programs that we offer in my office, it is clear that readers feel far more passionately about their sports teams. I want to congratulate all of the Illinois teams having success in the postseason, including the Loyola Ramblers men’s basketball team who are in the NIT Final Four, the Illinois State Redbirds women’s basketball team who are in the Fab Four of the Women’s NIT, and the ISU Redbirds men’s basketball team who just won the College Basketball Invitational tournament. A couple of people also pointed out success of their programs’ football teams last fall.  
More than a dozen Illinois colleges and universities advanced to postseason basketball tournaments this year. In addition to the teams already mentioned, others that did well in the postseason include the Bradley men’s team in the NIT and the Governors State women’s team in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics tournament. The Bradley Braves and the Governors State Jaguars each reached the quarterfinals before losing.  
I am a proud Illinoisan and root for Illinois teams over out-of-state teams. I am proud not just of our sports teams and their success, but the colleges and universities, both public and private, that produce remarkable graduates!
If you have a question for “The Mailbag,” please 
send me an email
 with the subject line “Mailbag.” I can’t promise that every one of your questions will run, but we do read them all and try to respond. And let us know if we can use your name, or if you’d prefer to be anonymous.
Email Your Questions
 
Treasurer Breaks Record for Investment Earnings 
In this photo from last year, Treasurer Frerichs addresses a U.S. House of Representatives committee in our nation’s capital.. 
The State Treasurer’s Office brought in a record $1.576 billion in investment earnings for the state portfolio in 2024, Illinois Treasurer Michael Frerichs recently told state senators. To put this into context, investment earnings were higher than state tax revenues collected from gaming ($1.458 billion), income from the state lottery ($886 million in FY24) and state revenue generated from cannabis sales ($490 million).
“Every dollar we make through smart, safe investing is a dollar that does not need to be raised in taxes or cut from important priorities, like our schools, health care, and roads and bridges,” Treasurer Frerichs told the Senate Appropriations Committee.
Treasurer Frerichs also highlighted his office’s success in returning missing money to people through 
I-CASH.
 When he took office, the number of I-CASH claims paid to constituents was about 60,000. That number was more than 325,000 during Fiscal Year 2024, and the cash amount totaled more than $300 million. For this fiscal year, the number of paid claims is expected to approach 400,000.
We may have missing money waiting for you. Check our 
I-CASH website
 at least twice a year.
Check for Missing Money Now
Illinois State Treasurer Michael W. Frerichs
1 East Old State Capitol Plaza
Springfield, IL 62701

subject: Notice of Time to File UI Quarterly Tax and Wage Reports
body:
Your Wisconsin Quarterly Unemployment Insurance Tax and Wage Reports and payment for first quarter 2025 are due on April 30, 2025. You can now login to your UI account at 
http://dwd.wisconsin.gov/ui
 and file the reports for first quarter 2025. If you've already filed the reports for first quarter 2025, no further action is required. 
You received this email because a user created Login ID subscribed to receive quarterly Time to File email reminders at this email address. This Time to File email reminder was not sent in reference to a specific Wisconsin Unemployment Insurance Account. 
If you no longer wish to receive this email, login to your account and update your email subscriptions. Email subscriptions are located in the "Other Functions" section of the Unemployment Insurance Online Services web site.
Please do not reply to this email. Questions or comments may be sent to 
taxnet@dwd.wisconsin.gov

subject: The EtA Launch Hub is Abuzz this Spring
body:
Explore business culture at our book club this week. Celebrate our EtA Launch Hub fellows as they gear up for their graduation.
No rain, no flowers.
- 
Haruki Murakami
 
Hi, Alisa:
My garden has come alive this Spring with lots of butterflies and ladybugs, particularly around the pigeon peas (also known as gandul or dhal) we planted in the Fall. Similarly, the participants of the 
EtA Launch Hub 
are alive and abuzz. They are attending their final sessions and preparing for graduation day on April 26th. It's amazing to witness their plans sharpen and their ideas (ahem) flourish.
On Graduation Day, the fellows will present their narrative statement concerning their search for a small to mid-sized business to purchase — the culmination of their efforts over the past 90 days.
If you are an investor or service provider interested in attending or participating in our one-hour graduation ceremony, please 
email me
.
Warm regards,
Karen
P.S.
We have book club this week on setting your business' culture. Investors are interested in your business' growth plans, and harnessing culture is a key part of that. Feel free to join the discussion, even if you haven't read the book.
UPCOMING EVENTS
Book Club: Cultūra with Michel Fabode
  
 
Thursday, April 3, 2025 
Replay: Doing A Geographically Focused Search
Wednesday, April 30, 2025
Save the Date: Unlocking Talent

subject: How to blend meritocracy and DEI
body:
April 1st foolery; new EEOC guidance; the impact on veterans; Morgan Stanley DEI backfires  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 April 01, 2025
In a shocking reversal, the White House today announced that it is restarting DEI initiatives across all government agencies, restoring funding to all universities, and offering tax breaks to any corporation that shows tangible progress on DEI. 
April Fools'!
 … unfortunately 😭 
 
All jokes aside, we are excited to introduce the 
MIME
 framework, which aligns the calls for meritocracy with key DEI objectives—see below.
 
– Team Aleria 
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them.
We almost never share links to podcasts, but this episode of 
The Future of Work
 is awesome: Jill Finlayson speaks with Bo Young Lee, who brings a wealth of experience to discuss some of the hottest topics about the DEI backlash. On the academic front, 
Harvard will offer free tuition
 to families making less than $200K/year—joining a few other elite schools in diversity push. And our unique work keeps attracting attention: check out the 
latest podcast
 and some quotes in 
CSO magazine
.
 
 
Aleria Happenings
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Introducing 
MIME
: the Measurable approach to Meritocracy for 
ALL
 Employees
Organizations are searching for ways to comply with the administration's executive orders and the call to “restore meritocracy." But how do you create a truly merit-based system that benefits
 all
 employees? Aleria's 
Measuring Inclusion and Merit for Efficiency
 (
MIME
) 
framework provides the answer.
 
Anchored in the 
MIME
 framework, our 
Inclusive Leadership
 and 
Inclusive Management Training
 
programs give your teams the knowledge, data, tools, and best practices to foster a high-performing, stable workforce—without guesswork, backlash, or legal exposure. 
Our training is fully customizable, from half-day sessions to multi-day deep dives, both in-person and virtually. 
With 
MIME
, you don't just talk about meritocracy—you implement it effectively in a way that benefits 
all
 employees!
 
 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide 
more details and answer any questions about how 
Measuring Inclusion and Merit for Efficiency
 can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities. Submit relevant events to 
info@aleria.tech
On April 3, 2025 at 12pm US/ET, join Charter and Understood for 
Neurodiversity and the Future of Business
, a discussion of the workplace designs, team dynamics, and leadership approaches to maximize the strengths of neurodivergent workers. The presentation includes case studies and resources that you can use in your own organization. 
Free registration
.
On April 3-9, 2025, join the 17th 
Annual ReelAbilities Film Festival: New York
. This amazing festival, which spans multiple venues and virtual showings, reframes disability and celebrates inclusion and accessibility through film. 
Get your tickets today
!
On April 9, 2025 at 12pm US/ET, join a Fairgodboss webinar on 
Allyship and Self-Advocacy for Career Growth
, featuring leaders from Cargill, who will discuss self-advocacy and allyship. Gain practical strategies to communicate effectively, boost confidence, challenge workplace biases, and foster an inclusive environment for career growth and support. 
Free registration
.
On April 10 at 11:00 am US/ET join our Chief Scientist Paolo Gaudiano for a FREE webinar on 
Rethinking DEI: Addressing Common Misconceptions. 
Paolo we'll dive into the misconceptions surrounding diversity and inclusion, address concerns about meritocracy, and explore practical ways to approach DEI while staying compliant with current policies. 
Free Registration
.
On April 21-24, 2025, The Winters Group will host 
The Power of Inclusion Summit
, a virtual conference designed to support the community during these challenging. There is a Pay What You Can option that lets you pay between $100 and $798 for the April 22-24 sessions. 
Learn more and register.
 
Spread the love!

If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.

subject: Our Latest Spring Updates
body:
From our 2025 Gala to key industry insights—catch up with us!
 
 
Hello, Creative Spirit Connect Community 
﻿Happy Spring! We have some exciting updates to kick off the season. 
First is our annual gala, which will be held on 
April 21, 2025, at 6 p.m.
in the Board Room at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE)
. 
We’ll be honoring our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity: 
Donna Murphy, Global CEO of Havas Health & Creative Networks
, and 
Raja Rajamannar, the Chief Marketing & Communications Officer at Mastercard
. 
We have set a brilliant goal: To empower neurodivergent individuals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the road to financial independence. 
Get Your Tickets at 
HireDifferent25.givesmart.com
. 
 
Donate To Our Mission.
 
 
 
 
 
We’re excited to announce a new partnership with Havas 
Neuroverse: Powered by Havas
,
 a groundbreaking consultancy that integrates neurodivergent talent into creative, marketing, strategy, and business transformation, driving innovation and fresh perspectives. With 53% of Gen Z identifying as neurodivergent, and 1 in 5 people identifying as neurodivergent overall, inclusive hiring is the right thing to do, and it’s smart business as well. 
Read The Full Story
 
Stay Informed With Our In-Depth, Original Content
We continue to cover some of the most important disability/neurodiversity rights issues, including challenges to Social Security, Medicare, and legislation like Section 504, which has protected the rights of people with disabilities (PWD) for decades. 
Rather than being deterred by these obstacles, we see critical opportunities to share the importance of defending disability rights and ensuring fair-wage employment for the neurodiverse community. 
﻿Times like these make us eternally grateful for supporters like you who enable Creative Spirit’s mission. Working together, there’s truly no limit to what we can accomplish.
 
Beating Burnout: A Guide for Employers and Neurodiverse Professionals
﻿
by Menachem Rephun
﻿Read the full story
For Over 50 Years, Section 504 Has Protected The Rights of People With Disabilities. In An Age of Uncertainty, How Do We Protect It?
﻿
by Menachem Rephun
﻿
Read the full story
Important Findings on Disability Inclusion in Deloitte’s Survey
﻿
by Menachem Rephun
Read the full story
 
For Employers: How We Can Help You Hire Neurodiverse Talent.
At Creative Spirit, we recognize that hiring neurodivergent talent goes beyond inclusion: it unlocks a competitive advantage.
 
Here’s how we can help your organization harness this incredible potential.
Tailored Consulting and Training:
 
We provide expert guidance to help you build a workplace where neurodivergent talent can excel. Our training for teams and hiring managers focuses on best practices for successfully integrating neurodivergent employees.
 
Skill-Based Job Matching:
 
Our specialized job-matching process connects you with candidates whose unique skills align with your business needs, paving the way for mutual success.
 
Employee Resource Group (ERG) Activation:
 
We assist in developing or expanding ERG's focused on neurodiversity, fostering a supportive culture that empowers neurodivergent employees and builds community.
 
Ongoing Mentorship and Coaching:
 
Our coaching services offer neurodivergent employees the guidance they need to flourish while we mentor managers in creating supportive and stigma-free work environments.
 
Expertise Across Industries:
 
Whether in media, PR, technology, or beyond, our industry experts help you refine hiring processes and create work environments that uplift neurodivergent talent. 
Whether you’re looking to enhance hiring practices or implement training/mentorship programs, we’re here to support you every step of the way.
 
Contact Creative Spirit so we can help you start hiring employees who are neurodivergent. Whether you’re looking to enhance hiring practices or implement training and mentorship programs, we’re here to support you every step of the way.
For Neurodiverse Individuals: How We Can Support You.
 
Since 2017, Creative Spirit has connected neurodivergent professionals with top companies, achieving a 95% retention rate through personalized coaching, mentorship, and job placement. We partner directly with organizations and candidates to drive meaningful career growth—because diverse workplaces are stronger and more innovative.
Creative Spirit offers coaching and job placement services if you want to grow your career. Do you know someone who could benefit? We welcome referrals! 
﻿
Introduce us via 
Terry.Ebert@creativespirit-us.org
 and 
Register Here
.
For additional information, contact us at info@creativespirit-us.org.
  
  
  
  
 
CREATIVE SPIRIT USA INC | 
183 McLain Street
 | 
Mt.Kisco, NY 10549 US
