subject: Project Forward Weekly Guidance - Issue 5
body:
­ 
March 28, 2025 - Issue #5
 
­ 
 
­ 
 
 
WEEKLY 
GUIDANCE
ABOUT PROJECT FORWARD
Led by BRIDGE, Project FORWARD is a cross-industry initiative, designed to chart our collective path forward and meet the current moment head-on. In partnership with top experts in academia, law and our board members, we are dedicated to equipping, educating, and empowering leaders in diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI), marketing, and business to continue to drive inclusive innovation and sustainable growth.
 
Every Friday, Project FORWARD provides critical updates on executive orders (EO) and legislative developments, featuring legal interpretations from 
Stacy Hawkins, Esq
.
, Diversity & Employment Practices Consultant and Rutgers Professor of Law, and 
Jessica Golden Cortes
, Partner, Labor + Employment Group, Davis+Gilbert LLP. We will also include the BRIDGE POV and tangible actions to consider.*
 
We encourage our community to remain informed and proactive. If you have questions or insights you’d like to share, please email 
projectforward@wearebridge.com
.
 
FOR PAST ISSUES OF PROJECT FORWARD WEEKLY GUIDANCE 
PLEASE VISIT HERE
.
 
*These Project FORWARD updates should not be construed as legal advice or counsel. They are for educational and instructive purposes only, to aid our understanding about how best to actively continue our mission in response to this moment. 
UPDATE ON PREVIOUSLY ISSUED EXECUTIVE ORDERS
OVERVIEW
For continued reference these are the EOs targeting DEI and LGBTQ+ protections that have been issued:
Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing: Executive Order # 14151
Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Executive Order # 14173
Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government: Executive Order #14168
 
As of today’s issue, there have been no further rulings on the above EOs. The latest update remains as published in last week’s issue: On March 15, the 4th US Circuit Court of Appeals panel reinstated portions of Trump’s executive orders targeting diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) programs and suspended the injunction issued by the lower court.
 
BRIDGE POV
At this time, while the current focus has shifted, there are 
strategic actions organizations can take to safeguard their Diversity, Equity & Inclusion practices and mitigate risk
. Additionally, though not directly tied to these EOs, there are
 emerging signals that offer deeper insight into this administration’s broader intentions
 that merit attention.
 
Beyond 
ensuring full compliance with existing laws
, the 
most powerful way
 to mitigate risk is to 
broaden your inclusion efforts across the organization 
- intentionally tying them to 
business outcomes and marketplace impact.
Inclusion can be
 transformational in driving business growth
, especially when activating historically untapped communities 
whose buying power continues to grow in scale and influence
Consider your 
inclusion maturity through a growth lens of how you see, serve and show up
 in the marketplace
EEOC ISSUES LETTERS AND DEI “GUIDANCE”
OVERVIEW
What To Do If You Experience Discrimination Related to DEI at Work | U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
 
What You Should Know About DEI-Related Discrimination at Work | U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
 
Letter to Acting Chair Lucas March 18 2025
 
 
As a reminder on March 17, the Acting Commissioner of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, Andrea Lucas, issued letters to 20 law firms requesting detailed information of their diversity, equity and inclusion programs asserting concerns of potential Title VII violations. The letters expressly target conduct involving race- or gender-based decision-making, or activities that classify, limit, or segregate employees in ways that could potentially deny certain groups—such as white or male employees—equal access to employment opportunities. 
 
As of March 26, 2025, the 20 law firms targeted by Acting EEOC Chair Andrea Lucas's letters regarding their DEI programs have not publicly responded to the requests. They have until April 15 to respond to the EEOC.
 
In addition to the seven former EEOC Chairs and Commissioners issuing a two-page letter in response, the 
Lawyers’ Committee for Civil Rights Under Law released a statement condemning the actions of Lucas:
“We condemn Acting Chair Lucas’ targeting of 20 named law firms working to advance diversity, equity, and inclusion in their workplaces. Acting Chair Lucas does not have the authority alone to act or speak on behalf of the EEOC as an official body.
 Official EEOC action requires a quorum of the five-member Commission, which currently does not exist after 
Trump fired two Commissioners
, breaking with precedent and possibly the law. 
 
While the rules allow individual EEOC Commissioners to initiate a charge of discrimination on their own initiative, all charges must be made under penalty of perjury. This prevents commissioners from initiating frivolous investigations or abusing the legal process. Lucas’ letters are not charges of discrimination. 
As such, they carry no more weight of authority than if they had been written on a cocktail napkin by any member of the public.”
 
And just yesterday, more than 50 state, local and specialty bar associations,
 including the American Bar Association issued a joint statement to “defend the rule of law and reject efforts to undermine the courts and the legal profession.”
 
LEGAL INTERPRETATION
It is important to note:
These
 
letters do not initiate formal administrative or legal proceedings against the law firms.
 In order to initiate formal administrative or legal proceedings against any employer, the EEOC would first need to file a charge of discrimination against the employer, or to intervene in a charge of discrimination filed by an employee/complainant. Since neither of these antecedent steps appears to have occurred, 
it is questionable whether these letters constitute a legitimate exercise of the Commissioner’s enforcement power under Title VII. 
 
Former EEOC officials have criticized the letters
 and urged Lucas to withdraw them 
expressing “grave concerns” that this order exceeds the agency’s enforcement duties under law. 
 
Furthermore, the letter argues that the EEOC Acting Chair has exceeded her enforcement authority under Title VII and other agency guidance, by contravening existing agency guidance endorsing DEI efforts as a means of furthering compliance with Title VII, rather than as evidence of non-compliance with Title VII. In fact, 
the EEOC is unable to alter any existing agency guidance on this issue because the agency does not currently have the required quorum of Commissioners (a minimum of three of the five statutorily designated Commissioners must be present to constitute a quorum) that would allow it to undertake many of its regulatory functions, such as revoking, altering, or otherwise modifying agency guidance.
Currently, due to Trump’s removal of two Democratic Commissioners shortly after his inauguration, the EEOC has only two Commissioners, which is less than a quorum.
 Although some work remains possible due to internal operating procedures that allow for routine work in the absence of a quorum (such as receiving and investigating charges of discrimination and issuing right-to-sue letters), 
much of the policy work of the EEOC is on hold until it has a quorum of Commissioners
.
 
BRIDGE POV
While these tactics are designed to create fear and uncertainty, they also offer insight into how the administration is interpreting DEI, particularly in the context  of workplace practices. This understanding can be used to inform how organizations can continue their DEI efforts while carefully mitigating risk.  
 
The Civil Rights Act, and the legal protections it affords, remains unchanged
 - as always employers need to continue to uphold these protections when evaluating their diversity, equity and inclusion practices
The (acting) chair of the EEOC has limited authority - 
no member of the Commission can unilaterally change the EEOC’s longstanding position on diversity, equity and inclusion
 or any other agency guidance
Leaders should take a pragmatic approach and avoid reacting by arbitrarily eliminating their DEI practices - instead without stigma, they should apply the same rigor of evolving DEI as they do to other core business strategies: 
identify what’s working and what isn’t, strengthen its connection to business outcomes and mitigate risk.
 
ADDITIONAL RESOURCES
Bar organizations’ statement in support of the rule of law
THE INTERSECTION OF IMMIGRATION AND DEPORTATION WITH COMBATTING ANTISEMITISM
OVERVIEW
Protecting the American People Against Invasion: Executive Order # 14159
Protecting the United States from Foreign Terrorists and Other National Security and Public Safety Threats: Executive Order # 14161
Additional Measures to Combat Anti-Semitism: Executive Order #13899
 
Upon taking office on Jan 20, 2025 
Trump issued a number of orders related to immigration, including orders 
Protecting the American People Against Invasion 
and 
Protecting the United States from Foreign Terrorists and Other National Security and Public Safety Threats
. Like many of the other Executive Orders, 
the titles often obscure the true intent framing them under the guise of something more palatable or benign. 
 
Additionally, within Trump’s first few days in office
 he reaffirmed Executive Order 13899 to combat Antisemitism
, issued in 2019, and directed additional measures to advance the policy.
 
LEGAL INTERPRETATION
The two above-mentioned orders relating to immigration call for a review of contracts, grants, and agreements between the federal government and “non-governmental organizations supporting or providing services, either directly or indirectly, to removable or illegal aliens.” 
 
In addition, the orders direct the Attorney General, Secretary of Homeland Security, and the Director of National Intelligence to 
identify all resources that may be used to ensure that all visa applicants, including F-1 and J-1 students, are “vetted and screened to the maximum degree possible.”
 The administration also issued a 
directive
 
repealing
 the Biden Administration’s 
“sensitive locations” policy, which prohibited raids by Immigration and Customs Enforcement or Customs and Border Protection agents at schools and other protected areas. 
Given the Administration’s focus on immigration enforcement, institutions are encouraged to 
proactively support international students in maintaining visa compliance and coordinate with campus offices and safety teams to establish a clear, unified response plan in the event of an immigration enforcement action.
 
Additionally, the America First Policy Directive to the Secretary of State executive order, which requires the State Department to align policies and programs to “put American and its interests first,” may impact international exchange programs and study abroad programs funded by the Department of State.
 
While 
business immigration policies have largely remained untouched
 thus far, this could shift. Trump has already 
signaled a return to strict immigration enforcement, including heightened scrutiny of foreign nationals and their employers as well as more rigorous "vetting" processes 
at U.S. Embassies and Consulates for foreign nationals obtaining visas abroad. Notably, his first administration attempted to overhaul the prevailing wage structure by significantly increasing employers’ wage obligations - a policy stance that may well surface over the next four years.
 
Compounding the issue however is the 
public rift within the Trump circle over the H-1B visa program particularly between the far-right and aligned tech allies.
 Though Trump 
previously criticized and temporarily banned the H-1B program 
during his first term, he has since
 reversed his stance, calling it a “great program.” 
This flip-flop has 
fueled internal conflict, as some see the visa system as undermining American workers, while others (ironically those against diversity, equity, inclusion) view it as essential to innovation and competitiveness.
 
This debate
 highlights the complex and evolving nature of the immigration policy and its potential impact on the tech industry and the broader economy.
 Concerns have been raised about 
equitable application of these and other policies suggesting that certain groups are being disproportionately targeted while others are being favored.
The 
Executive Order to combat Antisemitism sits at the intersection of immigration and civil rights policies, with immigration enforcement serving as one method of its implementation.
 
The Department of Justice (DOJ), in coordination with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), 
has initiated an investigation into the University of California (UC) system over allegations of a hostile work environment as a result of antisemitism against Jewish employees
, allegedly of Title VII’s prohibitions on race, national origin, and religious discrimination.
 
In furtherance of that Executive Order, Trump established a multi-agency Task Force tasked with gathering information and recommending actions to combat antisemitism. As part of this broader initiative, an investigation has been launched, aligning with recent statements from EEOC Acting Chair Andrea Lucas, who identified protecting workers from religious discrimination as a key priority. This mandate was echoed in a recent EEOC press release, which highlighted the agency’s collaboration with the DOJ to pursue coordinated enforcement efforts aimed at addressing antisemitism in the workplace.
 
Reports have emerged indicating that the administration is 
targeting college students with lawful immigrant status who publicly express support for Palestine by revoking their legal status and initiating deportation proceedings. 
 
Additionally, 
recent reports indicate that lawful individuals, including visa and green-card holders and international visitors have been detained at U.S. border crossings such as airports.
 
BRIDGE POV
The 
convergence of stringent immigration policies, civil rights considerations and allegations of antisemitism presents multifaceted challenges for businesses. 
Heightened immigration enforcement 
can impact workforce and workplace instability,
 particularly in industries reliant on immigrant labor and/or foreign nationals.
 
Simultaneously, businesses must 
navigate the complexities of civil rights and anti-discrimination laws while maintaining the delicate balance between compliance with federal mandates and respect for religious freedoms. 
Navigating these issues requires organizations to implement comprehensive policies and consistent values that uphold legal standards while fostering an inclusive work environment.
Work with all your employees who are 
Lawful Permanent Residents (LPRs) to ensure that all their documentation, identification and other proof of status is
 in order
Collaborate 
closely with your immigration counsel to establish clear guidelines so that immigrant employees understand their rights to ensure a smooth re-entry
 and ensure they have direct contact in the event they need assistance. For example:
U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officers have the authority to question individuals about their immigration status when entering or leaving the United States.
For lawful permanent residents (LPRs), it’s advisable to carry your green card and a valid passport from your country of citizenship. While LPRs are generally required to answer questions establishing their identity and residency, refusal to respond to other inquiries may lead to delays but technically should not result in denial of entry acknowledging that everything is less predictable and uncertain at this moment.
Non-citizen visa holders and visitors should be prepared to answer officers’ questions, as refusal may lead to denial of entry.
It’s important to note that officers may not select individuals for questioning based on religion, race, national origin, gender, ethnicity, or political beliefs. If you feel your rights are being violated during the screening process, you can request to speak with a supervisor.
Carrying contact information for an attorney or legal services organization is also recommended
Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), Business Resource Groups (BRGs) or affinity groups, a vital component of a comprehensive Diversity, Equity and Inclusion strategy, p
rovide much needed support to communities that are disproportionately affected by these policies
While these groups can be created in support of a specific community,
 it’s essential they remain open and accessible to all employees who wish to participate 
(establishing a code of conduct is acceptable)
Clear zero-tolerance policies against religious discrimination should be clearly documented and communicated 
to all employees. While the 
First Amendment protects individuals from government restrictions on speech, it does not extend to private employers
, allowing them to regulate employee expression within the workplace. However, 
employers must navigate the nuanced legal landscape when considering disciplinary actions related to lawful conduct during non-working hours.
 That being said, the restated EO to combat Antisemitism could insinuate more freedoms to employers around this issue.
This policy and other EOs could signal additional policies to be put in place around religious discrimination
 to allegedly "protect" Christian Nationalists against LGTBQ+ policies and practices, 
reinforcing the need of strong DEI teams to support these intentionally marginalized communities
 
ADDITIONAL RESOURCES
U.S. Justice Department Launches Investigation of University of California Under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964
 
 
EEOC Acting Chair Promises to Hold Accountable Universities and Colleges for Antisemitism on Campus Workplaces
HEADLINES TO WATCH CLOSELY
Over the last 24hrs, there has been a call, as outlined in 
Project 2025
, to defund NPR and PBS
FCC threatens to block media mergers over DEI policies - like with other agencies there will likely be questions around scope and constitutionality
COMMUNITY EVENTS
BRIDGE invites everyone to join for our 
monthly Community Calls
 which take place on the last Thursday of every month, gathering DEI marketing, and business leaders committed to driving systemic change within our organizations and the industry at large.
 
Our next call is 
Thursday, April 24th from 12-1p ET
.
ADD CALL TO CALENDAR
 
BRIDGE25: FORWARD
, our annual 2 1/2 day retreat will convene close to 200 of the top DEI, Marketing & Business Leaders at the stunning Seabird Resort overlooking the beach in 
Oceanside, CA, May 4-6.
Our commitment is to deliver and experience that will be 
unapologetically indelible, determined and audacious!
 
 
Spots are limited so please don't wait to sign up!
REQUEST AN INVITE
 
 
­ 
 
­ 
 
 
BRIDGE
1276 Auto Park Way Suite D, PMB 183, Escondido, CA 92029

subject: Small group medical policy update
body:
Plus: Form finder update, webinar + more
BLUE VISION
SM
News for Employer Groups
March 28, 2025
NEWS & UPDATES
Small Group Medical Policy Termination Process
Applies to fully insured small groups
Under the Affordable Care Act, when employers cancel medical coverage, they must provide adequate notice to all covered employees that the group medical policy will terminate on a chosen date. 
See the termination requirements.
 
Form Finder Update: What You Need to Know
Two big changes:
 Over a year ago, Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois introduced a new Form Finder experience for 
members
 and 
employers
. The easy-to-use tool is now home to over 900 forms. Here’s what you need to know:
In with the new:
 Form Finder will soon include all dental, vision, life, disability and supplemental health forms for members, producers and employers. 
Out with the old:
 We’ll remove forms in multiple places on bcbsil.com and Blue Access for Employers
SM
. Form Finder will be the source of truth for nearly all BCBSIL forms.
 
Two Ways to Access the Form Finder Tool
Direct Link:
 Get your 
Employer
 forms. Bookmark the page for future use.
Navigate:
 Go to bcbsil.com. Click the Employer tab, select Resources and choose Forms and Documents. A Form Finder button is near the top of every Forms and Documents page.
 
Using the Tool
Once you’re in Form Finder, enter keywords or select a topic from the category menu.
Click “All Forms and Documents” at the top of the category menu to display all forms.
In the results, forms display as line items. For details on each, click the down arrow for a description.
Exceptions:
 Forms for providers and forms related to Medicare products are not included in Form Finder. Get Provider forms 
here
. Medicare-related forms are accessed via the 
Forms and Documents webpage
.
April 2025 Worksite Wellness Webinar: The Importance of Financial Wellbeing in the Workplace
Applies to all groups
Financial industry surveys show that people worry about their finances more than they do their physical health. Research confirms that financially stressed employees are less engaged during the workday and spend up to three hours a week dealing with their finances. 
Get the details
 for this webinar.
 
Have Your Health Plan in Hand
Access your health plan information anytime, anywhere with our BCBSIL App. Get your member ID card, find doctors and hospitals, see your claims, coverage and out-of-pocket spending information and more. The app is available in English and Spanish for iPhone and Android users. Download it from the Apple App Store or Google Play Store. 
Go mobile
.
  
bcbsil.com
  
  
 File is in portable document format (PDF). To view this file, you may need to install a PDF reader program. Most PDF readers are a free download. One option is Adobe
®
 Reader
®
 which has a built-in screen reader. You can download other tools and learn more about accessibility at 
adobe.com
 
.

Talk soon!
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 10:13 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Sales Reminders & Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Morning!
In addition to looking for speaking opportunities at Chicago SHRM & Hacking HR, et al, I also wanted to mention 
Transform
 - an HR Org. They have a Chicago chapter & I believe you might know someone who is part of that 
@Chuck Adams
 - 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/drjaisonwilliams/
.
Have either of you secured a speaking gig (even if an informal chat / interview) for April or May? 
You can also check local chambers of commerce - not just the Chicago one, but for ex, the German American Chamber in Chicago.
Also, don't forget to please log any calls, notes, and reminders in HubSpot. LMK if you need help with this. 
Thank you!
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 10, 2025 9:54 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Fw: Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Good morning!
I will work to get an official doc together with all of this info (and will add more LinkedIn live-type shows), but in the meantime, I'm forwarding the below email with ideas for speaking. I know you have already started Alisa.
@Chuck
 - Maybe we have you slow down on the LCW webinars so you can focus on more of these? Would that enable you to do 1 a month you think? Or 1 every other month? LMK your capacity. I'd love to work out a calendar of sorts & have Kaitlyn put that together.
Thanks!
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 12:10 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Hi there,
I know we each have sales goals/KPIs & we are doing our best to reach those - making calls, responding to clients, tracking everything in HubSpot, etc. The LCW webinars, email campaigns, and our reach out efforts have increased traffic and interest in LCW - yay!
The areas I think we need to step up are 
speaking engagements & online presence.
I believe we agreed that 
Alisa
 would try to 
speak at 1 live event (virtual or in-person) once per month
. I know there is something upcoming.
I believe we agreed 
Chuck 
would try to do 
1 live event per quarter
,
 
in addition to
 the 1 or 2 LCW webinars
 he is leading 
each month
.
I would also kindly ask you both to 
post as much on LinkedIn
 as possible. I see you both do this. It would be great if you can increase that whenever possible.
To help in your search for where to speak, I've compiled the below orgs to help. 
As part of our
 sales strategy,
 we should be targeting 
legal
 orgs/associations (because they are always looking for DEI vendors & are often required to provide DEI services of some sort); 
HR 
orgs/associations (because as you know, we can find corporate DEI professionals here, and as DEI teams are disbanded, HR folks need to upskill), and 
Training & Development
 orgs/associations (similar to HR).
Here are suggested orgs to reach out to & approach for speaking gigs:
LEGAL
https://www.lcld.com/event/diversity-professionals-virtual-meeting-february-2025/
https://www.nalp.org/index.cfm
https://alfdp.com/
HR / L&D
https://hackinghrlab.io/events/people-culture-strategy-summit/
https://www.chicagoshrm.org/
 
https://atdchi.org/
I've attached a list of conferences
, but for most, we have missed the deadline for speaking. 
Of course there are many more opportunities out there. Please research on your own.
We hope to hire an admin shortly who can help us with these conference efforts - apply on our behalf to speak/present, find opportunities, etc.
Helpful tips:
Attached is a suggestion of what you can use to pitch to orgs to talk about - of course you can choose whatever you like
Post 3 times on LinkedIn about the event you will be speaking at
"Come see me speak at...."
Tag the LCW LinkedIn page & LCW employees so they can share
Tag the org hosting the event & others at that org you have spoken with
Tag others you know that might also spread the word - this can include clients, friends, orgs, etc.
"It's almost here - register for....." (tag as above)
"Thank you to X for having me..." (tag as above)
Use hashtags such as #DEI, #InclusionMatters, #BelongingAtWork #HR #HRLeadership #LearningAndDvelopment #TalentDevelopment
Happy to talk about this on our next call.
LMK if you have any questions.
Thanks!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW
Website
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
View our upcoming events
 | 
Sign-up for our newsletter

subject: Important: Upcoming changes to your HubSpot subscription
body:
Account: LCW (Hub ID: 23618458)
Hi Alisa Kolodizner,
On March 5, 2024, HubSpot launched a new scalable, flexible, and connected pricing model. Between May 31, 2025 and June 14, 2025, we’ll transition your account to the current pricing model.
What's changing?
As part of this transition, your subscription will be updated with new seat types tailored to your team’s needs.
At migration:
Your users will be 
updated
 to the new seat types. 
Super Admins should review your updated seat assignments
 in the Users & Team section of your HubSpot settings, with the flexibility to reassign seats at any time.
Your total fees won’t change, and there will be no systematic downtime.
Any new purchases, including additional seats, will reflect the 
new pricing model
.
Your price will not change at the time of migration.
 However, you may see a 
price increase of about 5% or less at your first renewal post-migration.
 Other factors, such as exceeding usage limits or expiring discounts, could also impact your price during your current term and at renewal. 
Where can I find more information?
You’ll receive an email at the time of migration with instructions to review your updated billing information before your next renewal.
Review the 
Frequently Asked Questions
 for more information on the new pricing model and how it may affect your business.
You can reach out to our Customer Success Manager. If you don’t have your Customer Success Manager’s contact information or have a HubSpot Starter account, you can reach out to 
HubSpot Support
.
Thank you for choosing to grow with HubSpot.
The HubSpot Team
P.S. You’re receiving this email because you’re a Billing or Primary Contact in a paid HubSpot account. Not the right person for this email? Please forward and update your contact information in Account & Billing.
HubSpot, Inc.
2 Canal Park,
Cambridge,
MA 02141, USA

Dear Alisa,
With Jewish American Heritage Month (JAHM) right around the corner in May, we’ve received requests from many Jewish Employee Resource Groups (ERG) about Project Shema resources and programming. 
I’m excited to share that we’re developing a new sharable resource and 
a virtual program
 that will be ready for May (JAHM).
We’ll be sharing the resource in May but if you would like us to do a program with your organization, let me know so we can start working on scheduling. 
I’m including the attached flyer and the program description below for ease.
And, feel free to set 
time with me here 
to get more details and discuss scheduling.
April Powers  (
She/Her/Ella/Elle/שֶׁלָה/كتابها)
VP Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion
projectshema.org
L: 
LinkedIn
Co-Founder 
Jewbian Princess
Check out our LinkedIn Learning Course!
____
Program/Resource Description:
Project Shema’s Jewish American Heritage Month resource and program captures the Jewish American journey through an exploration of 18 unique Jewish American experiences. The Jewish American story is one of milestones and breakthroughs (joys) in spite of arbitrary glass ceilings, exclusion, quotas, and even anti-Jewish violence (“oys”). The stories we spotlight are Jewish stories, but they are also quintessentially American stories—woven into the fabric of this country’s history. Join us for a celebration of Jewish joy in spite of the “oys” antisemitism created for Jews in the United States.

subject: The Hidden Risks of Relying on Proprietary Accounting Software
body:
The latest insights from AccountingDepartment.com
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page 
here
. 
Thought Leadership from the Leaders in Virtual Accounting & Bookkeeping Services
We hope you enjoy these recent posts from our blog...
The Hidden Risks of Relying on Proprietary Accounting Software
Thursday, March 27, 2025 1:57 PM
 
Accounting is the backbone of any business, from managing cash flow to ensuring compliance and long-term scalability. Many business owners turn to proprietary accounting software for streamlined financial management, captivated by promises of simplicity and powerful functionality. 
Read more »
    
Why Real-Time Financial Reporting is Essential for Your Business
Wednesday, March 26, 2025 3:36 PM
 
Financial reporting has long been a fundamental component of successful business management. It serves as the blueprint for decision-making, reveals opportunities, and identifies risks. Yet, in a rapidly changing economic environment, depending only on monthly or quarterly financial statements is gradually becoming outdated.
Read more »

body:

subject: Employee benefits innovation: Is your organization ahead of the curve?
body:
The latest group benefits enhancements and strategies to boost engagement
View this email as a web page 
here
 
Virtual Event
The Evolving Group Benefits Landscape: 
Key trends and insights
In an ever-changing business environment, and amid shifting employee expectations, understanding the trends shaping the group benefits landscape is more important than ever, especially as employers strive to attract and retain top talent. And as group benefits offerings evolve, there’s a lot to keep up with, from advancements in wellness programs and regulations to new technologies driving benefit administration.  
Join us
 as we explore the latest developments, emerging trends, and actionable insights within the group benefits sector. Topics will include the rise of personalized benefits and flexible plans, trends in mental health and wellness programs, strategies to enhance employee engagement with benefits packages, and projections for the group benefits market.
12–1 pm ET Wednesday, April 2, 2025

subject: Will you be joining us on April 21 to impact Neurodiversity and Celebrate Innovators?
body:
Help us reach our goal—one million fair-wage opportunities for neurodivergent professionals by 2030.
 
 
 
Join Us on April 21, 2025, at 6 pm 
at the Board Room of The New York Stock Exchange 
 
Dear Friends and Supporters of Creative Spirit,
We’re excited to remind you about our annual gala at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) on April 21, 2025. This year’s theme, 
Illuminating Brilliance
, reflects our bold vision: empowering neurodivergent professionals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the way to financial independence and workplace inclusion.
 
Honoring Our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity
 
Donna Murphy 
Global
 
CEO, Havas Creative & Health Networks
 
Raja Rajamannar 
Chief Marketing & Communications Officer, Mastercard
 
We are proud to honor two exceptional leaders whose work has significantly advanced neurodiversity in the workplace: 
Donna Murphy, Global CEO of Havas Creative & Health Networks, and Raja Rajamannar, Chief Marketing & Communications Officer at Mastercard. 
At Havas, 
Donna has led the way in fostering inclusion, most notably through the launch of 
Neuroverse: Powered by Havas
—a groundbreaking Neurodiversity Center of Excellence focused on embedding neurodivergent talent at the core of creative marketing, brand strategy, and business transformation. 
At Mastercard, 
Raja is a staunch advocate and pioneer of new standards in accessible design, Raja’s commitment has led to such initiatives as the Touch Card feature, a series of unique notches for payment cards that help people who are low or partially sighted pay with touch alone. This work has earned Mastercard accolades from Disability:IN, Fast Company, Cannes Lions and other prestigious organizations. 
Why Attend? 
Be a Catalyst for Change
Join a community dedicated to making an immediate, meaningful impact on workplace inclusion. Connect with trailblazers shaping the future of neurodiversity in business.
Celebrate Candidate Success
Hear from neurodivergent professionals thriving in their careers and leaders championing inclusive workplaces. Learn firsthand how Creative Spirit is driving fundamental change in neurodiverse employment.
Support & Empower Neurodivergent Talent
Engage with companies committed to fostering diverse, inclusive work environments. Discover how we can work together to create more opportunities for neurodivergent professionals.
Learn more about Creative Spirit’s training, coaching, and employment services to see how your support makes a difference. 
We are deeply grateful for your generosity—and can’t wait to celebrate with you!
 
Buy Tickets, Donate, Sponsor
 
Sincerely,
Lori Falcone & Martha Riley
Creative Spirit Gala Co-Chairs
 
Sponsorship Details
 
Click here 
to buy tickets, donate, and sponsor.
CREATIVE SPIRIT USA INC | 
183 McLain Street
 | 
Bedford Corners, NY 10549 US

subject: Must Watch: Mary Catherine Wilson on Partner Councils
body:
In this episode, Mary Catherine Wilson, CMO of Future Tech Enterprise, Inc., joins Sugata Sanyal to explore the impact of Partner Advisory Councils on vendor-partner collaboration, partner enablement, and business growth
 
Winning with Partner Advisory Councils
In this episode, 
Mary Catherine Wilson
, CMO of Future Tech Enterprise, Inc., joins 
Sugata Sanyal
, CEO of ZINFI Technologies, to discuss how Partner Advisory Councils enhance vendor-partner collaboration, enablement, and growth. Drawing on her experience at Accenture, Dell, and Future Tech, she shares strategies for building effective councils, engaging partners, and using feedback to drive improvements. The conversation also highlights AI’s role in transforming partner engagement and offers best practices for aligning vendor and partner goals through simplicity, predictability, and profitability.
Watch Video
 
Upcoming Event
 
Partner Ecosystem Leadership Symposium, Austin
Venue: Hotel Ella, Goodall’s Kitchen
Date: Thursday, April 10th, 2025 | Time: 2:00 pm – 6:00 pm
Register for FREE

Gain actionable insights, proven frameworks, and expert perspectives on how Partner Advisory Councils (PACs) can transform vendor-partner collaboration.

The platform helps my leaders decide where to focus their attention and where to place their bets. And the payoff has been massive. We’ve seen a 141% increase in the number of upselling deals closed per seller across the team.”
 
—
Jeff Weaver, VP Client Sales, Paycor
 
As he puts it, “I couldn’t be more sincere when I say that Gong’s AI is truly game changing.” How else can you describe a solution that helps a revenue team go from struggling to oversee their pipeline to one that manages it effectively, forecasts more accurately, and ultimately upsells to win 141% more deals?

efficiently get alerted on critical renewals for competitive and market-risk accounts.

education, and operations teams.

)

Perfect customer onboarding

Khoros
Outcome
: Gong’s features like scorecards and trackers allowed Khoros’ CS team to set streamlined goals across regions, which resulted in more focused feedback to CSMs and managers who could better coach their team to hit targets. More regular, consistent feedback led to greater accountability and skill-specific improvement.
Quote
: "Each of our five pillars can be addressed in a call with a customer through Gong. That’s where I’ve seen the power of the tool." - 
Chelsea Knudsen, 
Regional Manager of Customer Success
Momentive
 (see attachment)
Outcome
: Gong’s features helped the Customer Success team at Momentive move towards a more comprehensive customer success coaching program, which vastly improved the customer experience. Momentive now uses reality-based information to ensure that the entire team is on the same page, with a single standard of care that makes clients feel cared for
Quote
: 
"After listening to Gong calls, we realized that we could improve the consistency in how our customer-facing roles executed calls.”
 - Kim Nguyen Enablement Manager, Customer Success

subject: Connect with your market! Online resources!
body:
Digital/Online Marketing Tools
for Beginners
Thursday, April 10, 2025, 11am to 1:30pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
You must attend the webinar to receive the recording and slides.
Identify and Reach Your Market Niche!
 
Social media and digital marketing tools are an essential part of your marketing strategy, whether you are targeting other businesses or individual customers.
Let an experienced marketing and sales professional walk you through how to find and use the digital and social media resources that will help you successfully speak to your real market.
Great Q&A opportunities!
At the end of this webinar, you will have the resources and knowledge to:
List practical ways to increase sales, using targeted marketing strategies 
Summarize steps to increase your visibility on social media  
Describe how competitive research can position you more favorably  
Discuss tactics and steps to proactively prospect for new clients, with an emphasis on digital and social media      
Learn how to use Artificial Intelligence to allow you to perform multiple marketing tactics more efficiently and effectively.
Listen to what others have said about this presentation:
“Very informative and insightful. Tim was an authoritative and captivating speaker.“
“Tim was concise and informative. He spoke well and made it relatable and understandable. Definitely had some take aways from this session that will help me move my company forward”
“AI [Artificial Intelligence] information was helpful. Learning about SEO tools was great!”
Your Host & Speaker
﻿
Tim Contado
Tim Contado i
s a sales and marketing
professional with more than 25 years
of integrated marketing and sales
experience in Rubbermaid, Little Tikes,
Nestle, and several startups and private
companies. Tim has been a SCORE
﻿
mentor since Sept. 2016.
 
 
REGISTER
 
This webinar is brought to you for free
﻿through the generosity of a donor who wishes to remain anonymous.
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.

subject: Springboard’s 2025 MoxieCon Keynote Speakers!
body:
View this email in your browser
 
 
illustration shows a logo with the words Springboard Consulting dive in with precision in teal and orange lettering. It also has a picture of a diver.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Alvin Law, CSP, HoF -
 Day One
An international keynote speaker, Alvin is a 2-time Hall of Fame recipient, Emmy Award winner, and best-selling author.  Growing up without arms and persevering in the face of relentless challenges, Alvin helps people see beyond what’s missing and discover the possibilities that are within everyone’s reach.
_______________________________________________________________
Haley Moss - 
Day Two
Diagnosed with autism at the age of three, Haley Moss’ parents were told that she might not ever finish high school or earn a driver’s license. Today, she is an attorney, educator,   a sought-after commentator on disability rights and the Americans With Disabilities Act.  She is also the author of several books and articles that have appeared in outlets including the Washington Post, Teen Vogue, GQ, Bustle, Fast Company, Law 360 Pulse, and the ABA Journal.
 
ABOUT SPRINGBOARD®
Founded in 2005, Springboard is recognized as the expert in mainstreaming disability in the global workforce, workplace and marketplace. Serving corporations and organizations throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe and Asia, Springboard has become a trusted partner in relation to disability issues and initiatives across virtually every business category. Springboard annually honors exemplary organizational initiatives that promote the outreach, support & engagement of people with disabilities as employees and as consumers through the Disability Matters Awards. 
www.consultspringboard.com
.
Copyright © 2005 Springboard Consulting LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
Springboard Consulting, LLC
1611 E. Ashley, P.O. Box 1495, Folly Beach, South Carolina 29439-1495 US

Hi Steve,
I wanted to reiterate my interest in the public UCC sale. My previous LOI still reflects my intentions. From my understanding, since this is a public UCC sale, there are no legal documents that need to be processed in advance.
I’d prefer not to involve legal counsel before the auction, as it would be costly for all parties. My understanding is that you can share the UCC sale date, time, and any relevant details so I can attend the auction. If there is anything specific that you believe requires legal involvement before the sale, please let me know.
Once the UCC sale takes place, my legal team will handle the closing and any related matters. They have also pointed out a few caveats that I’d like to clarify:
·
 
Is there a specific contract under which the UCC sale must occur?
·
 
Can you respond to my LOI and confirm whether its terms align with what the LCW UCC sale is offering?
Looking forward to your response.
Andrew Rosenthal 
 
On Sun, Mar 16, 2025 at 9:36 PM Mr Rosenthal <
mrrosenthal85@gmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Steve, 
My name is Andrew Rosenthal, and I am interested in acquiring LCW through a private UCC sale. 
From my understanding gained through my discussions with Alisa Kolodizner, LCW has $500,000 in customer prepayments, raising concerns about its ability to continue operations, and making any assumption of customer contracts risky. Additionally, the current anti-DEI political landscape has significantly impacted LCW’s ability to acquire new customers. Given these factors, I believe a purchase price of $100,000 is fair. 
I am attaching an LOI to this email. 
A few key points regarding the LOI: 
1. The company’s current cash position consists entirely of customer deposits. 
2. The $100,000 purchase price includes all assets, including cash. 
3. I am prepared to move quickly once an LOI is accepted. 
Looking forward to your thoughts. 
Best, 
  
Andrew Rosenthal

body:
Cool.  C u soon!
 
 
One Love,
Howard Ross 
Founder, Udarta Consulting LLC
www.udarta.com
www.howardjross.com
Author
, 
 
 
“Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer.”
― 
Rainer Maria Rilke

Hi Steve,
I wanted to reiterate my interest in the public UCC sale. My previous LOI still reflects my intentions. From my understanding, since this is a public UCC sale, there are no legal documents that need to be processed in advance.
I’d prefer not to involve legal counsel before the auction, as it would be costly for all parties. My understanding is that you can share the UCC sale date, time, and any relevant details so I can attend the auction. If there is anything specific that you believe requires legal involvement before the sale, please let me know.
Once the UCC sale takes place, my legal team will handle the closing and any related matters. They have also pointed out a few caveats that I’d like to clarify:
·
 
Is there a specific contract under which the UCC sale must occur?
·
 
Can you respond to my LOI and confirm whether its terms align with what the LCW UCC sale is offering?
Looking forward to your response.
Andrew Rosenthal 
 
On Sun, Mar 16, 2025 at 9:36 PM Mr Rosenthal <
mrrosenthal85@gmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Steve, 
My name is Andrew Rosenthal, and I am interested in acquiring LCW through a private UCC sale. 
From my understanding gained through my discussions with Alisa Kolodizner, LCW has $500,000 in customer prepayments, raising concerns about its ability to continue operations, and making any assumption of customer contracts risky. Additionally, the current anti-DEI political landscape has significantly impacted LCW’s ability to acquire new customers. Given these factors, I believe a purchase price of $100,000 is fair. 
I am attaching an LOI to this email. 
A few key points regarding the LOI: 
1. The company’s current cash position consists entirely of customer deposits. 
2. The $100,000 purchase price includes all assets, including cash. 
3. I am prepared to move quickly once an LOI is accepted. 
Looking forward to your thoughts. 
Best, 
  
Andrew Rosenthal

subject: Want to Attract Investors? Here’s How.
body:
Pitching to Investors
Friday, April 4, 2025, 1pm to 4:30pm Eastern Time
In-person workshop in midtown Manhattan
Reserve My Spot
 
Persuading Investors is an Art 
AND
 a Science!
Presenting yourself to prospective investors 
﻿
can be key to funding success.
An effective pitch enhances your credibility and your chances of getting the resources you need to fuel your business.
 
Find out the key elements of an effective pitch and how to deliver a story that resonates. 
You’ll have an opportunity to practice your pitch and get real-time feedback.
At the end of this workshop, you will have the knowledge and resources to
: 
Differentiate between pitching to buyers and investors 
Identify the objectives of a compelling pitch 
Outline the key components of your company’s pitch 
Craft messaging that tells a compelling investor story 
Design investor outreach tailored to your company 
Deliver your pitch and handle investor Q&A effectively 
 
 
Speaker: Carolyn Katz
Former venture capital investor 
and small business owner; expert 
on startup and small business 
funding and preparation of investor 
and pitch materials; frequent webinar presenter on small business loans 
﻿
and other funding options.
 
 
REGISTER
 
This is a PAID, IN-PERSON workshop and will not be recorded.
﻿
Make sure you can attend in-person before registering.
 
 
﻿

subject: Russian Fluency + Pipeline Visibility
body:
Hi Alisa,

Saw on LinkedIn that you speak Russian. I’ve heard that “как дела?” holds a deeper meaning than just a greeting, sharing genuine care. Have you practiced it lately?

That said, if we could help you boost your close rates, would that be something you'd be open to?

Proshort's AI tool can process all your sales data and give your sales reps actionable insights on exactly what to do to close more opportunities.

For example, we can help you get answers to questions like:

- What key resistance do clients express regarding inclusivity outcomes when discussing transformational organizational development to address diverse workplace cultures?

- How do sales insights from past DEI projects impact proposals for client organizations seeking long-term sustainable practices in varied cultural contexts?  

It’s similar to ChatGPT, but for your sales data!

Worth a short chat?

All the best,
Lauren Mitchell
SDR
Proshort | Cupertino, CA
 

If you’re over it, reply “unsubscribe” and I’ll disappear quicker than a coworker at 4:59 PM on a Friday.

I-CASH
Bright Start 529
IL ABLE
Treasurer’s Note
March 26, 2025
Creating Jobs and Retaining Illinois Businesses 
The University of Illinois men’s basketball team didn’t do as well in the NCAA tournament as I would’ve liked.
I’m not sure I will ever be satisfied until they win a national championship. I had my heart broken in 1989 when the Flyin’ Illini lost a nailbiter of a game against Michigan in the Final Four. They had already beaten Michigan twice that year.
The 2005 Illini team was special. An Ohio State team stopped their undefeated season in the final seconds of the final regular-season game. Illinois went on to win the Big Ten Tournament and made it to the national championship game, losing to a North Carolina team that was playing with the referees on their side.
If it isn’t obvious by now, I grew up in Champaign County and I bleed orange and blue.
I especially love following U of I basketball, but there is a lot to be proud of in our state’s flagship University. U of I sports teams have won 23 
national championships
, and the school’s alumni and faculty have been awarded 28 
Pulitzer Prizes
 and 24 
Nobel Prizes
.
The Flyin’ Illini, one of the most talented teams Illinois has ever put on the court.  
John Bardeen
, a faculty member who died in 1991, is the only person to have won a Nobel in physics twice. He shared one Nobel for research on semiconductors and the invention of the transistor at Bell Labs, and he shared the other for the theory of superconductivity, developed at the U of I. 
The university is the No. 5-ranked engineering school in the nation, and it’s also among the country’s 
top five
 in several disciplines, including civil, materials science, computer, electrical, and environmental engineering.
The U of I also has one of the largest engineering programs in the U.S. Every year, it produces more engineering graduates than MIT, Stanford, and Caltech combined.
We produce a lot of world-class engineering graduates, but unfortunately, we also export a lot of them to the world. Many of those engineers who became entrepreneurs moved to Silicon Valley to start their companies. 
Marc Andreessen
, the co-founder of Netscape, the first commercial web browser, started his company in Champaign, but moved to the San Francisco Bay area. YouTube co-founders 
Steve Chen and Jawed Karim
, as well as PayPal co-founders 
Max Levchin and Luke Nosek
, were also U of I graduates who didn’t stay in Illinois. 
This is a big part of my motivation for creating the 
Illinois Growth and Innovation Fund
 and growing it to a $1.5 billion investment pool. I knew we could earn higher returns than from our traditional investments, but we can also help keep more of our entrepreneurs here in Illinois and attract some from other states. 
When entrepreneurs are growing their companies and want to grow them quickly, they frequently seek venture capital funding. In the past, when they have secured funding from San Francisco Bay Area firms, those firms suggested that they had to move their operation to Silicon Valley. 
When those entrepreneurs secured funding from Illinois-based venture capital firms, they almost never suggested moving to California. By helping grow the number and size of Venture Capital (VC) firms in Illinois, we keep more companies here in Illinois and employ more of our taxpayers. Today, we have invested over $700 million in Illinois VC firms. This has been a catalyst in these firms investing in 598 Illinois companies.  A study and our reporting have shown that we have been responsible for creating 19,000 jobs here in Illinois. 
Though the Illini didn’t do as well as I had hoped this year, I will just have to wait until next year for that national championship. In the meantime, Illinois graduates and entrepreneurs will continue racking up wins for our state.
Sincerely,
Michael
P.S
. I’d also like to mention two other Illinois university teams that achieved milestones in this year’s NCAA March Madness basketball tournaments. The Illini women’s basketball team won its first NCAA Tournament game in 25 years by beating Creighton in a first-round game. And the Southern Illinois University Edwardsville men’s basketball team played for the first time ever in March Madness. Congratulations to both!
 
Welcome to “The Mailbag,” which is your opportunity to ask me about topics like our programs, other state government functions, or anything else that interests you.
Q.
 Could you consider putting in place a loan program ASAP for college loans? I'm scared that recent developments with the federal Department of Education will affect student loans for fall. 
— Anonymous
A.
 Thank you for your note and thank you for reaching out regarding this issue. 
I share a similar concern around access to affordable loans to pay for college. In fact, we have launched a program directly addressing access to low-cost loans for residents attending universities and colleges here in the state. Our Student Empowerment Fund provides low-rate loans to make education more accessible for Illinois
 
residents who are attending a nonprofit or not-for-profit Illinois university. This program aims to alleviate student debt burdens in Illinois and make it possible for more students to pursue higher education. 
We have recently launched a low-rate private student loan products through the Student Empowerment Fund in which we have partnered with a reputable student lender to administer and service the private student loan products.
To date, we have launched two products:
 
Illinois Partnership Loan and the Illinois College Family Loan.
 These loans are for Illinois residents attending Illinois universities and have an interest rate cap of 7%. We will continue partnering with additional lenders to ensure we can offer student loan products for all Illinois residents.
You can read about our Student Empowerment Fund at our 
Student Loans page
 which gives a comprehensive overview of the program. 
If you have a question for “The Mailbag,” please 
send me an email
 with the subject line “Mailbag.” I can’t promise that every one of your questions will run, but we do read them all and try to respond. And let us know if we can use your name, or if you’d prefer to be anonymous.
Email Your Questions
 
 
Rockford-area families are invited to attend the 
Discovery Center Museum
 
next month. Illinois State Treasurer Michael Frerichs’ 
Bright Start 529 program
 is sponsoring $5.29 day. A family of four can make it a day for $21.16. That’s a $26.84 savings! 
Here are the details: 
Saturday, April 5, from 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 
Discovery Center Museum
, 
711 N. Main Street, Rockford
Admission is $5.29 for children and adults!
Kiddos can make their own piggy banks at the "Little Savers Crafting Workshop,” which is open to the first 400 children. Families also are invited to speak directly with members of the Bright Start 529 team to learn more about how a 529 account can help achieve their education goals for their children after graduating high school. The event is sponsored by 
Bright Start 529
, an Illinois 529 college savings plan. 
The Discovery Center Museum event is part of an ongoing effort by the State Treasurer’s Office to collaborate with select Illinois children’s museums to organize free and reduced-price admission days and spread the word about college savings plans. 
You can find out more about Bright Start and opening an account at 
brightstart.com
. You can read important disclosures, including information about investments, fees, and risks related to Bright Start 
here
 and Bright Directions 
here
.
Find Out More about $5.29 Day

Springfield, IL 62701

Hi Steve,
I wanted to reiterate my interest in the public UCC sale. My previous LOI still reflects my intentions. From my understanding, since this is a public UCC sale, there are no legal documents that need to be processed in advance.
I’d prefer not to involve legal counsel before the auction, as it would be costly for all parties. My understanding is that you can share the UCC sale date, time, and any relevant details so I can attend the auction. If there is anything specific that you believe requires legal involvement before the sale, please let me know.
Once the UCC sale takes place, my legal team will handle the closing and any related matters. They have also pointed out a few caveats that I’d like to clarify:
Is there a specific contract under which the UCC sale must occur?
Can you respond to my LOI and confirm whether its terms align with what the LCW UCC sale is offering?
Looking forward to your response.
Andrew Rosenthal 
On Sun, Mar 16, 2025 at 9:36 PM Mr Rosenthal <
mrrosenthal85@gmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Steve, 
My name is Andrew Rosenthal, and I am interested in acquiring LCW through a private UCC sale. 
From my understanding gained through my discussions with Alisa Kolodizner, LCW has $500,000 in customer prepayments, raising concerns about its ability to continue operations, and making any assumption of customer contracts risky. Additionally, the current anti-DEI political landscape has significantly impacted LCW’s ability to acquire new customers. Given these factors, I believe a purchase price of $100,000 is fair. 
I am attaching an LOI to this email. 
A few key points regarding the LOI: 
1. The company’s current cash position consists entirely of customer deposits. 
2. The $100,000 purchase price includes all assets, including cash. 
3. I am prepared to move quickly once an LOI is accepted. 
Looking forward to your thoughts. 
Best, 
  
Andrew Rosenthal

subject: Spring Holidays in the Classroom
body:
Dear Tanenbaum Community, 
As Spring 2025 begins to bloom, celebrations—including 
Eid al-Fitr
, 
Easter
, 
Passover
, 
Vaisakhi
, 
Vesak Day
, and the 
National Day of Reason
—add color and meaning to the season. Students in your classroom, or colleagues in your building, may celebrate some of these upcoming occasions, which hold important meaning for many across the globe. 
Click on any of the holiday names above for a Tanenbaum fact sheet with key details about each celebration.
  
Inspire students to learn about different holidays, about one another, and about the world around them. 
Tanenbaum’s free downloadable lessons
 help educators teach about religious and non-religious holidays while building understanding across core subjects and sparking meaningful peer-to-peer connections. 
Bracketing Beliefs in Learning about Religion
 
opens a door for student learning about how religious traditions and practices evolve over time and can be found throughout civic culture. 
Observing Religious Holidays
 invites students to explore family traditions while recognizing similarities and differences. 
Who’s in the Room?
 encourages self-to-world connections through personal storytelling and shared experiences.
Create an inclusive classroom where all voices are heard and valued this Spring! Bring Tanenbaum’s lessons and educator resources including the new 
Tanenbaum Bookshelf
 into your classroom to elevate respect for religious differences. To learn more, email us at 
education@tanenbaum.org
.  
Warmly, 
Rev. Mark Fowler, CEO, Tanenbaum, and the Education Team 
 
At this crucial time, you can actively fight religious hatred by supporting Tanenbaum. Our real-world solutions make peace possible in the U.S. and globally.
Donate Today!
 
Manage
 your preferences | 
Opt Out
 using TrueRemove™

Sign up
 to receive our future emails.
View this email 
online
.
200 Broadway | New York, NY 10038 US

To continue receiving our emails, add us to your address book.

subject: Your annual 401(k) account fee is changing
body:
Taking effect on 5/1/2025
͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ ͏ ‌     ­ 
​
​
​
Hi Alisa,
We’re writing to let you know about an upcoming adjustment to fees charged on your Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC 401(k) account.
What’s changing
Effective on 5/1/2025, your annual account fee will change from 0.08% to 0.15% on assets under management. Guideline remains one of the most affordable 401(k) providers available. Combined with low fund fees, the new pricing is up to 6x lower than the industry average
1
.
New features
Guideline is committed to helping everyone arrive at a secure retirement. Be on the lookout for new upcoming features aimed at enhancing our saver experience, including after-tax savings, mega backdoor Roth, and expanded investment funds and vehicles.
How the annual account fee is calculated
Each month, on behalf of Guideline Investments, LLC, we’ll deduct 1/12 of the 0.15% account fee, which is based on your month-end account balance
2
.
For more information about how we calculate this fee and to view an example, 
see here
.
Where to learn more
If you want to know more, take a look at our 
pricing FAQ
 or view additional information about our fees in the Guideline Investment 
ADV 2A Brochure
.
Team Guideline
Any questions?
View our 
FAQs
 to learn more about this update.
​
​
1. This information is provided for illustrative purposes only, and is not intended to be taken as investment or tax advice. Consult a qualified tax and financial advisor to determine the appropriate investment strategy for you. The average investment expense of plan assets for 401(k) plans with 25 participants and $250,000 in assets is 1.37% of assets, according to the 24th Edition of the 401k Averages Book, with data updated through September 30, 2023, and is inclusive of investment management fees, fund expense ratios, 12b-1 fees, sub-transfer agent fees, contract charges, wrap and advisor fees or any other asset based charges. Investment advisory services for Guideline’s 401(k) product (when 3(38) fiduciary services are appointed) and SEP IRA/IRA products are offered by Guideline Investments, LLC, an SEC-registered investment adviser. The managed portfolios have blended expense ratios ranging from 0.067% to 0.069% of assets under management. When combined with an assumed account fee of 0.15% charged by Guideline Investments, LLC, the estimated total AUM fees for one of the managed portfolios can be under 0.22%. Alternative account fee pricing is available ranging from 0.15% to 0.35%. Contact Sales at 
hello@guideline.com
 to learn more about exclusive pricing options available in the Enterprise tier. See the 
Form ADV 2A Brochure
 for more information regarding fees. Expense ratios for custom portfolios will vary. These expense ratios are subject to change by and paid to the fund(s). View 
full fund lineup
.
2. Information shown here assumes a static balance of $10,000 per month, an assumed annual account fee of 0.15% on assets under management (calculated and deducted on a monthly basis at 1/12 of the annual stated rate (0.15%) based on the month-end account balance) and does not account for common factors that affect the value of your account balance over time such as gains, losses, distributions, additional contributions, etc. It’s not intended to be taken as investment advice or as an assurance or guarantee of future performance. The fee presented does not include other fees that a 401(k) participant may incur from other third-parties or affiliates, including, but not limited to, from mutual fund expense ratios and a monthly maintenance fee to participants who end employment. Alternative account fee pricing is available, ranging from 0.15% to 0.35%. Contact Sales at 
hello@guideline.com
 to learn more about exclusive pricing options available in Enterprise tier.
Copyright © 2025 Guideline, Inc. All rights reserved.
1412 Chapin Avenue, Burlingame, CA 94010
guideline.com

 about how we protect your information.

 and 
Form CRS
.
Recordkeeping services for Guideline’s 401(k) and SEP IRA/IRA products are offered by Guideline RK, LLC. 3(16) plan administrative services are also offered by Guideline RK, LLC and only made available to clients who utilize an eligible payroll provider. Guideline uses a third-party to provide custodial services.

Subject:
 Bank balance planning
 
Hi Alisa, I put together the numbers for the things that are going to be hitting our Wintrust deposit account in the next 30 days. We will need to add money (at least $12,000) before 4/5, when I expect the big 401k draft to go out (assuming the scheduling works the way I think it does on their end). It might be good to move that sooner in case it happens differently for the off-cycle run, and if it doesn’t hit that day I’ll keep my eyes open to be sure we have enough to cover it when it comes. There’s currently plenty in the Citi account to cover everything I expect to hit Wintrust in the next 30 days.

subject: Sales Reminders & Speaking Opportunities
body:
Morning!
In addition to looking for speaking opportunities at Chicago SHRM & Hacking HR, et al, I also wanted to mention 
Transform
 - an HR Org. They have a Chicago chapter & I believe you might know someone who is part of that 
@Chuck Adams
 - 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/drjaisonwilliams/
.
Have either of you secured a speaking gig (even if an informal chat / interview) for April or May? 
You can also check local chambers of commerce - not just the Chicago one, but for ex, the German American Chamber in Chicago.
Also, don't forget to please log any calls, notes, and reminders in HubSpot. LMK if you need help with this. 
Thank you!
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 10, 2025 9:54 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Fw: Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Good morning!
I will work to get an official doc together with all of this info (and will add more LinkedIn live-type shows), but in the meantime, I'm forwarding the below email with ideas for speaking. I know you have already started Alisa.
@Chuck
 - Maybe we have you slow down on the LCW webinars so you can focus on more of these? Would that enable you to do 1 a month you think? Or 1 every other month? LMK your capacity. I'd love to work out a calendar of sorts & have Kaitlyn put that together.
Thanks!
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 12:10 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Hi there,
I know we each have sales goals/KPIs & we are doing our best to reach those - making calls, responding to clients, tracking everything in HubSpot, etc. The LCW webinars, email campaigns, and our reach out efforts have increased traffic and interest in LCW - yay!
The areas I think we need to step up are 
speaking engagements & online presence.
I believe we agreed that 
Alisa
 would try to 
speak at 1 live event (virtual or in-person) once per month
. I know there is something upcoming.
I believe we agreed 
Chuck 
would try to do 
1 live event per quarter
,
 
in addition to
 the 1 or 2 LCW webinars
 he is leading 
each month
.
I would also kindly ask you both to 
post as much on LinkedIn
 as possible. I see you both do this. It would be great if you can increase that whenever possible.
To help in your search for where to speak, I've compiled the below orgs to help. 
As part of our
 sales strategy,
 we should be targeting 
legal
 orgs/associations (because they are always looking for DEI vendors & are often required to provide DEI services of some sort); 
HR 
orgs/associations (because as you know, we can find corporate DEI professionals here, and as DEI teams are disbanded, HR folks need to upskill), and 
Training & Development
 orgs/associations (similar to HR).
Here are suggested orgs to reach out to & approach for speaking gigs:
LEGAL
https://www.lcld.com/event/diversity-professionals-virtual-meeting-february-2025/
https://www.nalp.org/index.cfm
https://alfdp.com/
HR / L&D
https://hackinghrlab.io/events/people-culture-strategy-summit/
https://www.chicagoshrm.org/
 
https://atdchi.org/
I've attached a list of conferences
, but for most, we have missed the deadline for speaking. 
Of course there are many more opportunities out there. Please research on your own.
We hope to hire an admin shortly who can help us with these conference efforts - apply on our behalf to speak/present, find opportunities, etc.
Helpful tips:
Attached is a suggestion of what you can use to pitch to orgs to talk about - of course you can choose whatever you like
Post 3 times on LinkedIn about the event you will be speaking at
"Come see me speak at...."
Tag the LCW LinkedIn page & LCW employees so they can share
Tag the org hosting the event & others at that org you have spoken with
Tag others you know that might also spread the word - this can include clients, friends, orgs, etc.
"It's almost here - register for....." (tag as above)
"Thank you to X for having me..." (tag as above)
Use hashtags such as #DEI, #InclusionMatters, #BelongingAtWork #HR #HRLeadership #LearningAndDvelopment #TalentDevelopment
Happy to talk about this on our next call.
LMK if you have any questions.
Thanks!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Re: Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service recognition for Language Culture Worldwide based on our subscriber inputs
body:
Good morning Alisa,
I hope all is well.
I'm contacting you with an exciting update. Let me emphasize that Language Culture Worldwide is shortlisted for the 
'Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service 
2025'
 recognition in our upcoming edition with a client-centric profile.
As the 
SOLE company
 to receive this recognition in our forthcoming edition, Language Culture Worldwide will be provided with reprint rights to showcase its excellence to a broader audience.
The profile will provide an in-depth look at your expertise, strengths, and strategic vision, highlighting what sets you apart from others. The story will be channeled to resonate more effectively with your target audience. Alongside your company's profile, we will feature articles from decision-makers, enhancing your visibility among top HR professionals.
I am excited to share the names of some of the prominent industry leaders who wrote articles for our renowned magazine.
1) 
Melisa Byrd
, Director of Compensation & Benefits at 
Tate & Lyle
2) 
Erik Doyle
, Director of Talent and Organizational Development at 
Patrick Industries
3) 
Hanna (Wolf) Buckner
, External Communications and Employer Brand Lead at 
Brown-Forman
Previously recognized companies in our magazine significantly enhanced their visibility and revenue. Your recognition in a renowned magazine can increase visibility and generate more inbound inquiries. At the same time, the reprints of your recognition will make your prospects more confident about engaging with your company.
We are eager to schedule a conversation between you and our senior manager, who is more capable of discussing how you can maximize the benefits of this recognition through our Print and Digital Reprint Rights.
Please let me know your availability for a conversation, and I'll schedule it promptly.
Regards,
Priscilla
______________
Priscilla Nelson
Manage HR
510 972 5010
______________
Hi Alisa,
My name is Priscilla, and I am from 
Manage HR
, a prominent publication with a readership of 129,000 qualified subscribers.Our magazine shares news, insights, and expert opinions on the best HR practices from top HR professionals and Business managers specializing in HR functions.
I am happy to share to that we have shortlisted Language Culture Worldwide for the '
Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service
  
2025'
 feature in our upcoming edition.This recognition is based on nominations received from our subscribers, who liked your offerings and suggested them to othersThis honors reflects your outstanding contributions by providing Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service and the rapport you've built among customers and peers.
Your company will be the 
SOLE company 
felicitated by this recognition, and we are providing your company reprint rights for this recognition.
To commence with this recognition, we would like to feature a profile for your company in this edition, highlighting what makes you unique among hundreds of other companies in the HR domain. Our editorial team will work closely with you to draft a narrative that accurately describes your services. This profile will provide deeper insights into your strategic vision and leadership in this domain, giving potential clients a clear understanding of your offerings.
In addition, this engaging profile will be featured alongside articles from several decision-makers who will share their experiences, insights, and challenges with their peers. This prominent placement will elevate your visibility and influence among decision-makers actively seeking reliable collaborators in this domain.
Our previous clients who received similar recognitions from our magazine have significantly increased their visibility.Furthermore, being showcased in our print and digital platforms has attracted more attention from subscribers and website visitors.Similarly, Language Culture Worldwide can increase its prominence and visibility with the help of this Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service recognition.This endorsement from a renowned magazine enhances your credibility, making your services more appealing to prospects.
Along with the recognition reprints, your company will receive some unique features, which include a Recognition Logo, a Certificate, and other benefits in our magazine, all for $3,000.Furthermore, your company’s profile will also be hyperlinked directly to its website, increasing the potential for inbound inquiries from our subscribers and website visitors.
Our magazine follows a peer-to-peer learning approach, featuring insights from senior decision-makers such as Directors of HR Operations, Recruitment & Talent Directors, and others. These industry leaders share their experiences and ideas through our platform, helping readers stay ahead of emerging updates.We serve as a key media partner for top events and conferences throughout the year, providing exposure and assisting businesses in connecting with their target audience.
I would like to connect and discuss how your company can leverage this recognition to increase its visibility, just like our previous clients. Please suggest a convenient time to connect.
Regards,
Priscilla
______________
Priscilla Nelson
Manage HR
510 972 5010
______________

subject: Plan, Grow, Succeed: Master Your Business Financials!
body:
Do Your Financial Projections!
Wednesday, April 9, 2025, 1pm to 3pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
You must attend the webinar to receive the recording and slides.
 
Build a solid foundation for your business.
 
﻿
Financial projections help you assess the profitability of your business, prepare for future events and access the resources you need for future growth and a healthy bottom line.
Two experienced SCORE NYC Mentors will take you through four forecasting fundamentals that will make your projections a success!
They will share case studies to show you how the process works!
At the end of this session, you will have the resources and knowledge to:
Summarize 4 forecasting fundamentals: Business Plan Basics, Importance of Stating Assumptions, Sales Forecast Preparation, and Assembling a Profit and Loss Statement ready to show to investors and/or lenders 
Describe the assembling of financial projections based on the examples of two small startup businesses 
Utilize the relevant Financial Planning templates and tools 
Recap the 6 key criteria that lenders are looking for
 
 
Your Speaker:
Jerry Baron
Owned financial consulting firm; 
expert in business plan 
development, working with 
startups and nonprofits. 
﻿SCORE NYC Mentor.
 
 
Your Speaker:
Sandy Eames
Marketing and business 
development executive, 
consultant with expertise 
in business plans development. 
﻿SCORE NYC Mentor.
 
 
LEARN MORE AND REGISTER
 
This webinar is brought to you for free through the generosity of
a donor who wishes to remain anonymous.
 
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.
 
 
SCORE NYC | 
712 H St NE PMB 98848
 | 
Washington, DC 20002 US
