subject: We want to hear from you! SECOND REQUEST.
body:
Fill out a quick survey inside.
 
 
 
Anonymous Survey
Dear Friend of SCORE:
We are sending this ANONYMOUS survey a second time because we really do need your help. If you've already responded, thank you. If you haven't, this is your chance to help us improve your experience with SCORE.
﻿At this time, the New York City SCORE Chapter is embarking on a project to raise funds from foundations and corporations to assist us in continuing to provide quality mentoring programs and workshops to the many clients we serve. The purpose of this questionnaire, which should only take a few minutes to complete, is to gather demographic and other information about our current and past clients that is often requested by potential funders.
It would be greatly appreciated if you would fill in the answers below that most closely relate to your involvement with SCORE New York City and finish the survey as soon as possible. We reopened this survey because we need higher participation.
In advance, thank you for helping us better serve the greater New York City community. Please be assured that your answers to this survey are completely anonymous. Feel free to skip any questions that you prefer not to answer.
Let's go!

subject: FS Client Alert: New Director Appointed to Transition OFCCP to New Mission
body:
View in browser
 
 
FS Client Alert:
New Director Appointed to Transition OFCCP to New Mission
On March 24, 2025, the U.S. Department of Labor (DOL) 
announced
 Catherine Eschbach as the new Director of the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP).  In an email to OFCCP staff, Director Eschbach announced that under her leadership, all reform options are on the table and “most of what OFCCP has been doing is out of step, if not flat out contradictory to our country’s laws.”  Her email went further to outline “OFCCP’s transition to its new scope of mission”:
Verifying that federal contractors have wound down their affirmative action efforts 91 days after President Trump’s EO 14173 rescinded EO 11246.
Examining federal contractors’ prior submissions to determine whether there are any indications of discrimination and whether OFCCP should undertake additional investigations.
Advising the Secretary of Labor of measures to deter DEI as required by Section 4 of EO 14173.
Determining statutory authority for Section 503 and VEVRAA and whether they should be housed elsewhere in Labor Department.
“Rightsizing” the staff and geographic footprint of agency.
Federal contractors should pay particular attention to the last bullet above.  The new Director indicates that OFCCP will review prior submissions from closed audits to review for illegal DEI.  If you receive any communication from OFCCP, or other federal agencies, with regard to past submissions or requesting additional information from closed audits, please contact your FortneyScott attorney immediately.
With this transition of enforcement for OFCCP, federal contractors need to take the necessary action and steps to ensure they understand and comply with the new obligations as outlined in EO 14173 and above.  FortneyScott is assisting many of its clients in these matters.  Please reach out to your FortneyScott attorney should you have any questions.  
 
 
 
 
Fortney & Scott, LLC
1909 K Street, NW, Suite 330
Washington, DC 20006

subject: Your Business Plan, Your Success!
body:
A Business Plan That Meets Your Needs
Wednesday, April 2, 2025, 11am to 1pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
You must attend the webinar to receive the recording and slides.
A well-crafted business plan is crucial to the success
﻿
of your business.
The plan is a flexible road map to guide you as you build, grow or diversify your business. It also establishes your credibility with 
potential investors and funders. 
Two experienced SCORE NYC mentors will walk you through the key elements of an effective business plan. 
 
 
At the end of this webinar, you will be able to:
 
Describe the reasons to prepare a business plan 
List the top 10 requirements for success 
Assess your business model 
Summarize the structure of a business plan 
Discuss the business planning process based on a small business case study
 
Speaker:
Sandy Eames
Marketing and business development executive with expertise in business strategy, business plans, outbound marketing product development 
and strategic alliances. 
﻿
SCORE NYC Mentor.
﻿
Speaker:
Jerry Baron
Experienced professional 
providing growth strategies for 
small and mid-size businesses, especially start-ups and nonprofits. SCORE NYC Mentor.
 
REGISTER
 
This webinar is presented free through the generosity of
a donor who wishes to remain anonymous.
 
 
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.
 
 
SCORE NYC | 
712 H St NE PMB 98848
 | 
Washington, DC 20002 US

subject: State stuff
body:
Hi.
I have been working with someone on UpWork - Linda - who is great in getting us what we need to solve some of this state stuff. However, I am not even able to pay balances for some states like New Mexico & North Carolina because I'm not on the account, nor do we have login info for most of the state's online accounts.
I know you are swamped, but you are going to have to be the one to contact these places to pay any balances & request refunds. I know it is a lot. Let me know if you have any questions.
New Mexico Department of Workforce Solutions - Call 877.664.6984
We used to owe $48.02 for unemployment - not sure if it has gone up since our last note
Account #1005146
North Carolina Employment Security (NCSuits) - Call 866-278-3822
We used to owe $129.37
Account #0000659394
Update to new address (see below)
Add me as authorized user if you are able
Get access to online account if you are able
Minnesota Unemployment Insurance - Call 650-296-6141
Request credit of $579.56
Request our account be closed as of 6/30/23 - account #05103092
Update to new address (see below)
Illinois Department of Revenue
Please sign attached doc (Step 2)
 - this will remove Randy & add you & me so we can apply for a refund. I should be able to get the refund without your help. Then I should be able to create an online account for us and make other updates.
New Jersey - Do you have online login info?
New address:
Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC
2501 Chatham Rd #8413
Springfield, IL, 62704, USA
Thank you!
Nicole

subject: Apply to WMNfintech — applications close 4.10.25!
body:
Accelerate your fintech venture through 1:1 guidance, pitch opportunities, and a tailored curriculum.
 
Hi Alisa
 
In case you missed it… 
WMNfintech
 is back! For the sixth year in a row, the award-winning program, developed by 1871 and BMO, will be giving 
5 select startups
 access to invaluable resources that will take their ventures to the next level.
Apply today - applications close April 10!
 
Click to view the official press release!
 
Why apply?
Program alumni have created 200+ jobs and raised $45+ million in capital
Gain 1:1 guidance from top BMO industry experts
Engage with a specialized curriculum focused on enterprise sales cycles, vendor management, information security, and risk and regulatory requirements
Gain pitching opportunities resulting in exposure, feedback, mentorship, and strategic connections
& more!
Here’s what your WMNfintech experience could look like ⬇
 
Eligibility: 
WMNfintech is open to startups who have:
A working, assumptions driven financial model and analytics tied to each relevant step of the customer journey
A U.S. focused product and/or solution
A built minimum viable product (MVP)
A team consisting of more than 1 person
Meet last year's cohort!
 
Team 1871
 
Global Innovation Hub
 
1871
, 222 W. Merchandise Mart Plaza, 
Suite 1212,  Chicago, IL, 60654

subject: We reject the erasure of truth so you can, too
body:
History and facts will only be suppressed, not erased, if we read truth together  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
We reject the erasure of truth
 
 
No government or institution anywhere can truly erase the facts of history.
 
Because we won't let them.
 
But it's going to take all of us, every single one, empowering each other with the 
truth of real history
 of the land we now know as the U.S.
 
It's up to us to speak and read truth to our young people.
 
Our Race To The Truth series is one important tool you need in your anti-erasure toolkit.
 
Buy your copy of our book for young elementary-grade readers, 
This Land - the History of the Land We're On 
by Ashley Fairbanks, and all the books in our series, 
here
.
 
 
you need to read truth too! join a big read of our “white women” book
 
Please join this Big Read of our book, 
White Women
! Get more details, including links to discussion groups and additional resources, 
here
. This Big Read runs through the end of April and is free to participate.
 
Whether this is your first or tenth time reading the book, there will be something in this for you. There has never been a more urgent moment to talk about systemic racism and how EVERYONE can be a part of dismantling it!
 
If purchasing the book is a barrier for you, the first five people to 
join
 the Big Read from this email can receive a free paper copy of the book (U.S. addresses only for shipping free books, please).
join the big read here
 
Thanks for joining us in rejecting erasure of Black, Indigenous and brown people,
Regina + Saira
 
Private Address
Denver, CO 80207, United States
Unsubscribe
 or

Serial Growth Lab 
by HauerX Holdings
March 25, 2025
 
Turning AI Innovation into Market Leadership
 
AI isn’t the future—it’s the now.
While you’re “exploring,” your competitors are deploying.
They’re integrating AI into their core business, gaining an edge, and defining the next decade.
The rest?
They’ll be playing catch-up.
AI isn’t just automation—it’s an unfair advantage for those who know how to use it. 
It’s a once-in-a-generation arbitrage opportunity, and the window won’t stay open forever.
This newsletter is built for leaders who don’t wait for the future—they create it. 
Every edition breaks down what’s working, what’s not, and how to turn AI into real, measurable business impact.
Let’s dive in.
01—CEO Presentation: 5 Proven Strategies for Turning AI Innovation Into Market Leadership
Stop Tiptoeing—Go All-In
 
02—Rapid Fire Demo: Watch FifthRow's AI Agents Power Innovation, Strategy, & Market Research
Explore Adding AI Co-Workers To Your Team
 
03—Case Study: How AI Agents Automated Regulatory Sensing for a Fortune 500 Leader
Explore The AI Agent Use Case & Impact
 
04—Join An Exclusive AI for CPG Leaders Breakfast in NYC With Our Partner, Board of Innovation | April 22, 8-10AM
Email For More Info
 
AI isn’t just reshaping industries—it’s deciding the winners and losers.
The only question: Are you leading or reacting?
If you’re serious about turning AI strategy into a competitive advantage, let’s talk.
Reply to this email or reach out directly.
Let’s put AI to work—together.
Jason
Jason Hauer
CEO, HauerX Holdings 
513.368.3073
jason@hauerX.com

subject: Re: LCW x Hacking HR
body:

I hope you're doing well! I wanted to follow up to see if you had any questions about our proposal.
As we approach our upcoming 
HR Technology Summit in April

special sponsorship opportunity at $8,000

.
Please let me know if you'd like to discuss this further—I’d be happy to hop on a call or provide additional details.
Laurie

subject: Alisa K on the Front Cover - Leaders Special Edition 2025
body:
Hi Alisa,
I hope you are well.
I understand your position, but I genuinely believe you are a right fit for the editorial feature detailed in my previous email.
We would be pleased to work with you on this. Kindly share your thoughts when you have a moment.
Looking forward to your response.
Best,
Masey
From: Masey Williams <Masey@cioviews.com> wrote:
Hello Alisa,
This is Masey Williams from CIO Views Magazine.
I’m excited to share that our editorial team has begun working on next quarter (Q3-2025) calendar, and I’m thrilled to inform you that we will be launching a special edition in May 2025.
Edition Title: The Most Influential Business Leaders to Watch in 2025
Release month:-  
May 2025 
This edition aims to celebrate the dawn of a fresh start by spotlighting transformative business leaders who are shaping the future. Their innovative strategies and inspiring journeys will provide valuable insights and motivation for others as we embark on the opportunities and challenges of 2025.
We would be honoured to 
feature you on the front cover of this special edition
. Our goal is to craft a narrative that truly captures your achievements and the impact you’ve made, offering invaluable insights to our readers.
As a featured leader, you will receive:
Front Cover of the Edition
Eight-Page Cover Story Article
Five Printed Copies of the Magazine
Back Cover Advertisement
Digital Certificate of Acknowledgment
Digital Award for Participation
Edition Logo
Social Media Image for Promotion
Feature on Our Social Media Channels
One Guest Article in a Future Issue
Year-Round Press Releases
The participation fee for this feature is 3,500 USD.
We believe your story would significantly enrich this edition and resonate with our audience. If you’re interested or have any questions, kindly let me know. I’d be happy to provide more details.
Looking forward to your positive response.
Best regards,
Masey Williams
Business Development Manager
CIO Views Magazine 
Office: 
+1 (737) 285-0724
Fax: 914-462-3214
Unsubscribe
 
CIO Views LLC, 13740 N Highway 183 Ste L2 #281, Austin, Texas 78750, United States

subject: Blend's New Alumni Board, Tomorrow's Happy Hour & More!
body:
We're strengthening our community with the launch of a new Alumni Board. Meet the members at our VC Happy Hour tomorrow!
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Meet our VC Fellowship Alumni Board!
 
Chicago:Blend
 is taking another step toward creating a more inclusive venture capital ecosystem with the launch of our 
Alumni Board
. Comprised of accomplished graduates of the 
Chicago:Blend Venture Fellowship
, this board will play a vital role in supporting future VC fellows, providing mentorship, and driving Chicago:Blend's mission forward.
With a focus on ongoing learning, networking, and events, the board is set to make a significant impact in shaping a more inclusive VC landscape. This work is made possible through generous support from 
Origin Ventures
.
READ MORE
 about the board's initiatives and how you can get involved.
Events
 
Chicago VC Happy Hour with V2:VC
🗓️  Wed, March 26
🕔  5:00 - 7:30p CDT
📍  Fulton Market (address shared after registering)
For VCs only! No programming, no pitches—just an excuse to gather with our friends at 
V2:VC
.
Register
 
 
State of the Markets 2025: Navigating the New Venture Landscape
🗓️  Tue, April 1
🕔  8:30 - 10:00a CDT
📍  Workbox, Fulton Market, Chicago
Join this essential briefing on market trends and strategies for founders, VCs, and angel investors, featuring expert insights on the economic landscape, venture capital shifts, survival tactics, and 2025 opportunities.
Register
 
 
1871 Innovation Summit: Emerging Tech
🗓️  April 16-17
🕔  Day-long programs
📍  1871, River North, Chicago
Join 1871 for the 
Emerging Tech Innovation Summit
 on April 16-17—two days of AI and Web3 innovation, learning, and networking!
Register
 
From the Community
• 
APPLY
 for the 
2025 Black Ambition Prize Competition
, which offers underrepresented founders access to growth capital, coaching, and a powerful network of mentors and innovators. 
Applications due May 2.
 
Thank You to Chicago:Blend's Sustaining Donors

> wrote:
Dear Alisa,
I hope you are taking care!
As we find our path FORWARD, on behalf of the 
BRIDGE Board of Directors
, I am honored  to invite you to 
BRIDGE25
 taking place 
May 4-6 at the Seabird Resort & Spa in Oceanside, CA
. 
There has perhaps never been a more important time for us to come together as a resolute community committed to building a more inclusive industry. 
While DEI has become politicized, misrepresented and overstated, the practice of inclusion remains transformational to business growth
. And those companies that understand this will future proof their businesses for years to come. 
Because of your participation
, together we have achieved a phenomenal and consistent
 
NPS score of over 90!
 
As you know, the 2 ½ day retreat immerses
 Chief Diversity Officers, CMOs, CEOs and other senior leaders 
in a unique environment built to deliver actionable insights and foster data-driven solutions to operationalize inclusion across the workplace, workforce and marketplace and protect it from unfounded attacks.
BRIDGE25 will center around 
data-driven best practices and business capabilities 
needed to
 
ensure that brands tap into their growth markets with robust strategies on how they see, serve and show up in the marketplace.
Our commitment to you is that BRIDGE25: FORWARD will be unapologetically 
indelible, determined and audacious 
as
 
we bring together an incredible lineup of speakers, actionable content, close friends and partners and immersive cultural experiences all in one place!
We hope you will join us! 
Register today
 
as 
space is limited and take advantage of our Early-Early Bird pricing.
Please let me know if you have any questions and as always let me know how we might support your efforts.
Hope to see you in May!
Forward,
SD
sheryl daija (she/her/hers)
founder & chief executive officer
BRIDGE

subject: Bill Reminder
body:
Dear Alisa Kolodizner,
We just wanted to send you a quick note to remind you that your credit card (VISA ***7849) will be charged soon. 2025-03-26 to be exact. If you need to make any changes to your account, make sure you do so before then. To make changes, just log in to your account and select the "Edit Account" option under the Account tab.
Please note, if you've generated registrations (or if this is your first bill), and you downgrade to the Trial plan, you'll be billed at the rate of your currently selected plan.
Have questions about your upcoming invoice? 
Let us know
, we’d be happy to help answer them for you.
Thanks for using SCORM Cloud!
-- The SCORM Cloud Team

From:
 Joe Wabick <
Jwabick@kreshmore.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 2:03 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
I see the emails, we can work through all this together live. I went ahead and made you a basic template. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

subject: 5 Things: Chicagoland's Weekly Business Update
body:
Delivered by Southwest Airlines 
 
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
 
 
 
 
Weekly Business Update 
March 24, 2025
Delivered by
 
THE EXCHANGE
Grow Your Network at Soldier Field – Special Ticket Offer Available Now 
PRESENTED BY
 THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
Join The Exchange 2025, the Chicagoland Chamber’s largest networking event, on April 10 at Soldier Field for an afternoon of business growth and connections. Meet hundreds of professionals, explore 100+ exhibitor booths, engage in Speed Networking by LinkedIn, and gain expert insights from Chamber Chats on workforce trends and small business health insurance. Plus, enjoy complimentary drinks and samples from the Culinary Showcase. For a limited time, buy 3 tickets and get 1 free!
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
Talent Talk: Scaling without Borders – Global Talent Strategies for Chicago's Innovators 
PRESENTED BY FRAGOMEN
 
Struggling to find top-tier talent in today’s competitive market? Attend the Talent Talks Series, an exclusive event designed to help founders and tech leaders navigate evolving hiring strategies, visa uncertainties, and remote work trends. Hosted by 1871, MobSquad, Fragomen, and the Canadian Consulate in Chicago, this evening of networking and conversation will provide actionable insights on securing international talent and scaling your team effectively. Connect with industry leaders, gain expert perspectives on the H-1B landscape, and explore innovative workforce solutions—all over great food and drinks.
REGISTER NOW
 
MEMBER NEWS
New Pathways & Possibilities in Hospitality Education
PRESENTED BY NATIONAL LOUIS UNIVERSITY
 
The future of hospitality education is evolving, with new models emerging to address workforce challenges and bridge the gap between students and employers. Join industry leaders for a dynamic discussion on innovative training approaches, including apprenticeships, vocational programs, and collaborative efforts between government, nonprofits, and colleges. Chicagoland Chamber Board Chair Dan Lynch will be among the featured speakers, sharing insights on how these evolving pathways can create a more prepared and motivated hospitality workforce. Don’t miss this opportunity to explore the future of talent development and connect with key stakeholders shaping the industry’s next chapter.
REGISTER NOW
 
MEMBER NEWS
Breaking Barriers: Transforming Women’s Health Luncheon 
PRESENTED BY THE AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY
 
Join the American Cancer Society on Wednesday, April 30 for the Breaking Barriers: Transforming Women's Health Luncheon, benefitting the ResearcHERS movement, which funds women-led cancer research and addresses the underrepresentation of women in leadership roles. Spend the afternoon networking with peers and hearing from a distinguished panel of experts on critical women’s wellness issues, cancer risk factors, and the physical, mental, and financial challenges many women face. Discover how these factors impact health outcomes and cancer risks and learn about the efforts being made to improve women’s health nationwide.
REGISTER NOW
 
UPCOMING EVENT
AI in Action: Solving Real Business Challenges
PRESENTED BY THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
Discover how AI can address real challenges within your organization in this interactive workshop. We’ll begin with an overview of cutting-edge AI tools and real-world applications, showcasing how businesses are leveraging AI for success. Then, in small breakout groups, you’ll collaborate to develop practical AI use cases tailored to your organization’s needs. Walk away with actionable insights and strategies to implement AI-driven solutions effectively. Register by April 15 to receive an early-bird rate.
REGISTER NOW
 
Want to showcase your company news, information, products, or services?
 
Chamber members are able to take advantage of a myriad of benefits to help your business grow, including inclusion in this email newsletter. With a broad distribution, you can gain access to a new audience that you may not otherwise be able to reach.
REVIEW BENEFITS
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER
 
 
 
 
 
WWW.CHICAGOLANDCHAMBER.ORG
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
The Wrigley Building | 410 N Michigan Ave | Suite 900
Chicago, IL 60611

From:
 Joe Wabick <
Jwabick@kreshmore.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 2:03 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
I see the emails, we can work through all this together live. I went ahead and made you a basic template. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
I see the emails, we can work through all this together live. I went ahead and made you a basic template. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

subject: Re: Investor Note 2025
body:
Hi Alisa
I read this note...it is extremely well written.
The circumstances of prior years and recent development/events which brought us to this inflection point are detailed succinctly; while providing an alternative to bankruptcy. The note did not have the financial attachment probably as this is circulating. 
The also note does not 
address potential purchasers, i.e. boutique private companies, PE or even publicly traded companies, 
who will or won't be involved selecting the purchaser, 
how the remaining business will be valued or how the troubled debt/loan reductions were derived
timeline for closing and 
significant impact the restructuring could/will have to each investor's equity. i.e. when if ever can investor expect a ROC
Did you consider having a Teams call with all investors to discuss situation prior to issuance of letter or as a follow-up after the note is sent.
Let me know if questions.. 
Best Regards
....
Frank J. Arcaro
847-212-8445

On 2/27/2025 5:05 PM, Chet Foster wrote:
Per our call, here are the 10 claims that I think you can't win and you should agree not to pursue.  Let me know if you agree so I don't have to mess around briefing claims you won't be pursuing.Thanks
Chet
 
 
 
1.
                     
Respectfully, I do not believe you have the evidence to sustain your initial burden of proof with regard to the following 7 claims:
 
a.
      
The 2022 Tax Appeal [Par 11A (iv)], Nasr not Mubarak was the Appellant;
b.
      
The 2022 Tax Appeal [Par 11A ((vi)], Nasr not Mubarak was the Appellant;
c.
       
The claim Mubarak gave gifts in excess of $600 to his son [Par 11C] - Mubarak only gave his son $250;
d.
      
Failure to list wife’s income from gaming proceeds [Par11I] - Mubarak’s wife was not receiving any income from gaming proceeds on the Petition Date;
e.
       
Failure to take Pre-Petition Credit Counseling [Par. 11J] - Mubarak took the counseling & a certificate of credit counseling was filed with the Court;
f.
        
Mubarak’s failure to explain his transfers of Marshfield Station’s 
assets
 to his wife. [Par 14B(iii)] - Mubarak gave no Marshfield 
assets
 to his wife; and
g.
      
Mubarak’s failure to preserve documents re his transfers of Marshfield Station’s 
assets
 to his wife. [Par 17A(iii)] -  Mubarak gave no Marshfield 
assets
 to his wife.
 
Accordingly, I am suggesting that you agree not to pursue these claims at trial, so neither of us have to brief them and spend any more time on time
 
2.
                  
I don’t believe you can prevail on your two claims relating to Mubarak’s alleged interest in Bubbles Car Wash [11D & 14C], or your claims relating to Mubarak’s failure to list his interests in insurances [11G], which I assume you brought when you thought Mubarak was hiding his interest in a MetLife Policy, which I showed you lapsed before the Petition Date.  In the interest of streamlining the litigation, I am suggesting that you agree not to pursue these claims as well.
Chester H. Foster, Jr. 
Foster Legal Services, PLLC
16311 Byron Dr.
Orland Park, IL 60462
Phone: (708) 403-3800
Fax: (708) 403-4095

On 2/26/2025 1:25 PM, Chet Foster wrote:
Ariel, in advance of our 4:30 call today, here are some of my thoughts and suggestions on how to streamline this case.
1.
                  
I believe that the overwhelming majority of facts in our case are undisputed.  So I would like to stipulate to as many facts as possible.  I think the proposed stipulations I have sent to you is a good start.
 
2.
                  
As you will see, I propose that Mubarak will stipulate to all of the schedule omissions & I am proposing that Plaintiffs will stipulate to all of his amendments listing the omitted items, none of which should be in dispute.
 
3.
                  
I do not think we need to include the entire originally filed Petition, Schedules and SoFa.  I propose to just include those portions thereof relating to the omitted items. These would be the pertinent portions of: 
 
a.
       
Doc. 1  filed 5/28/23;
b.
      
Doc 16 filed 7/31/23;
c.
       
Doc 26 filed 10/26/23;
d.
      
Doc 35 filed 1/26/24; and
e.
       
Doc 36 filed 1/26/24
This will enable the Judge to quickly find the pertinent passages, should she wish to review them, without having to search through all of the materials.  However, I also propose that we stipulate to what the pertinent Schedules and SoFa items are, which would probably eliminate the need for the Judge to actually review the Docketed items themselves.  For Example, we will stipulate that Mubarak did not list his watch in his original schedules, but that he filed an amended Schedule A/B listing it and an Amended Schedule C claiming it as exempt.  I don’t see why the Judge would need to review the original and amended schedules to confirm these facts.
4.
                  
I think we should try to keep the number of Exhibits to a minimum.  I think we can do so by stipulating as to what many of the Exhibits would show without the need to actually file the exhibits themselves.
 
5.
                  
The Accel Monthly Revenue Statements consist of a great many pages.  In my proposed Exhibit 26, I put together a summary of the monthly Accel payments broken down for each of 2019, 2020 & 2021.  If Plaintiffs will stipulate that the Monthly Summaries were tendered to them and they show the annual totals indicated on Exhibit 26, which they do, there would be no need to file the actual Monthly Revenue Statements, eliminating the need to file many pages that the Judge will never really look at.
 
6.
                  
Similarly, in lieu of Plaintiffs including the Marshfield LLC bank statements showing the transfers between PPI and Marshfield, LLC (your Exhibit 42), I suggest that you prepare a one page Exhibit listing each of the transfers, which we will stipulate to.  
 
7.
                  
I was going to file the Marshfield Station bank statements (Ex 23) that show each of the Accel Deposits going into the accounts, which is a whole lot of paper.  I am asking that Plaintiffs Stipulate that Mubarak gave them copies of these Bank Statements, in lieu of us filing the actual Bank Statements, which the Judge is never going to look at.
 
8.
                  
I was going to file bank statements showing when the $150K and $350K EIDL loans were deposited into the Marshfield Station Bank Accounts and when the $350K was transferred from Marshfield Station to Marshfield LLC (Ex 47 & 48).  I think we can just stipulate as to when those funds were deposited and transferred, and once again save a lot of paper. 
 
9.
                  
I have decided that I am not going to file the transcripts of Paul’s deposition.
 
10.
              
I have decided that I am not going to file the transcripts of Mubarak’s CDA Exam.  
 
11.
              
I have decided that I am not going to file the transcripts of Mubarak’s 2004 Exam.  I assume you will.  Please note that Judge Cox’s PTO provides:  
 
The parties shall submit a list of all depositions or portions thereof to be read into evidence, with a transcript of the testimony to be read.  The entire deposition transcript must be submitted.  Deposition testimony proffered shall be highlighted in color.  Any additional testimony of the same witness proffered by another party shall be highlighted in a different color.  The procedure set forth above for objecting to the admission of the testimony of a witness shall apply to objections to deposition designations.
 
12.
                 
Our Stipulations are supposed to include stipulations to the introduction of our Exhibits.  Notwithstanding the objections I raised to your original list of Exhibits, I am pretty sure we can work out agreements as to the admissibility of all of the relevant Exhibits.
 
13.
                 
Notwithstanding the fact that we both produced long lists of witnesses we will or may call, if we can stipulate to the matters that I believe are not in dispute, I suspect the only witnesses will be Mubarak, Syed and maybe Nasr.
 
14.
                 
Respectfully, I do not believe you have the evidence to sustain your initial burden of proof with regard to the following 7 claims:
 
a.
       
The 2022 Tax Appeal [Par 11A (iv)], Nasr not Mubarak was the Appellant;
b.
      
The 2022 Tax Appeal [Par 11A ((vi)], Nasr not Mubarak was the Appellant;
c.
       
The claim Mubarak gave gifts in excess of $600 to his son [Par 11C] - Mubarak only gave his son $250;
d.
      
Failure to list wife’s income from gaming proceeds [Par11I] - Mubarak’s wife was not receiving any income from gaming proceeds on the Petition Date;
e.
       
Failure to take Pre-Petition Credit Counseling [Par. 11J] - Mubarak took the counseling & a certificate of credit counseling was filed with the Court;
f.
       
Mubarak’s failure to explain his transfers of Marshfield Station’s 
assets
 to his wife. [Par 14B(iii)] - Mubarak gave no Marshfield 
assets
 to his wife; and
g.
       
Mubarak’s failure to preserve documents re his transfers of Marshfield Station’s 
assets
 to his wife. [Par 17A(iii)] -  Mubarak gave no Marshfield 
assets
 to his wife.
 
Accordingly, I am suggesting that you agree not to pursue these claims at trial, so neither of us have to brief them and spend any more time on time
 
15.
              
I don’t believe you can prevail on your two claims relating to Mubarak’s alleged interest in Bubbles Car Wash [11D & 14C], or your claims relating to Mubarak’s failure to list his interests in insurances [11G], which I assume you brought when you thought Mubarak was hiding his interest in a MetLife Policy, which I showed you lapsed before the Petition Date.  In the interest of streamlining the litigation, I am suggesting that you agree not to pursue these claims as well.
 
16.
              
During the hearing yesterday, when Judge Cox extended the page limits on our Trial Briefs to 25 pages, at my request she clarified the terms of the PTO as follows:
 
a.
       
Dispositive Motions & Motions in 
Limine 
are to be filed with the Clerk of the Court;
b.
      
Our Joint Submission, which gets filed to Judge Cox and not filed with the Clerk of Court, must include: (i) Our Trial Exhibits, objections and objection responses; (ii) Witness Lists, objections & objection responses; and (iii) Joint List of Stipulated Facts;
c.
       
We each separately file our Trial Briefs and Proposed Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law with Judge Cox. We do not file them with the Clerk of Court; and
d.
      
We each need to deliver to Judge Cox two tabbed binders containing our Exhibits.
I hope you get a chance to glance at this memo in advance of our call, which I will plan on you initiating.  
Chet 
 
-- 
Chester H. Foster, Jr. 
Foster Legal Services, PLLC
16311 Byron Dr.
Orland Park, IL 60462
Phone: (708) 403-3800
Fax: (708) 403-4095

subject: Steps to Franchise Ownership –March 26 @1pm
body:
Register today!
 
 
 
﻿Steps to Franchise Ownership
﻿Wednesday, March 26th, 1 pm ET
FREE WEBINAR
xxx
 
Learn if franchise ownership is for you! It has proven to be been quite an appealing career pursuit and/or investment option for many. Naturally, we all think of burgers and donuts, but there are some 4,000 franchise concepts across 250+ industries! Scores of 'wantrepreneurs' have been drawn to it to pursue their entrepreneurial passions in a risk-mitigated manner. Franchises can offer proven models, brand recognition, training & support, marketing assistance, and much more to help you achieve your goals/wants/needs. Franchises come in all shapes and sizes (i.e., full-time vs. semi-involved,) and with varying levels of investment.  
During this webinar, we’ll cover: 
﻿
Franchising landscape - definitions, myths, key considerations
Who buys franchises and why do they buy?
Franchise models compared. Why/how do they work?
 
Can't Make the Live Session? 
Don't worry, everyone who registers will receive the slides and recording the day after the webinar. 
Register Now
 
 
 
 
 
Presenter:
Frank Dunne
Frank Dunne is a seasoned Franchise Consultant at Frankly Franchising, who helps 'wantrepreneurs' achieve their dreams of business ownership by matching them with the best franchise options based on their skills, goals, interests, budget, and lifestyle. As a Certified Franchise Consultant and a member of the 
International Franchise Professionals Group
, he has access to more than 500+ franchise and non-franchise opportunities in various industries, and can guide clients through an exploration thereof. With more than 15 years' experience working as a franchise coach, multi-unit franchisee, franchisor, and outsourced franchise recruiter...Frank has deep industry knowledge and perspective and leverages it to work with qualified clients on a no-cost basis.
 
 
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.

26 Federal Plaza 3100

New York City, NY 10278 US

subject: RE: Information post Call Follow-up
body:
Hi Adam,
 
Happy 2025. I was really impressed with you last year and would like to engage your services for a few questions that I have as a second opinion. I also wanted to ask for a recommendation from you. Please let me know what your schedule permits. My best email is; 
alisa@cordelia.capital
 and cell is below; 773-430-3534.
 
Thanks,
 
Alisa

From:
 Adam P. Silverman <asilverman@ag-ltd.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, December 5, 2024 1:05 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Information post Call Follow-up
 
Hi Alisa:
 
Sorry for the delay in responding. I had a bit of a fire drill this morning. Here is what I can do on our firm’s retention vis-à-vis your requests. I can drop our requested retainer from $25,000 to $15,000 and reduce my rate to $525.00 an hour, with the understanding that our firm cannot become a creditor of an insolvent client. I understand your request to go to $500.00 an hour, but $525.00 an hour is our lowest tier rate structure so I cannot create a new one. As for limiting my involvement to a finite number of hours, I frankly do not feel comfortable going into a matter having committed to something that equates to only being partially involved. We can work together to limit your instructions and my authority, but my representation of the entity renders me completely professionally and ethically responsible regardless of how much time I put into it. Last, after reviewing my notes, I don’t have any new ideas since we first spoke, but a lot the creativity and advice comes after legal due diligence. 
 
Finally, I do not believe I requested your tax return. Ariel may have so I want to point that out to you. No doubt it will help to know what is in it to collaborate with Ariel, but I am not the one who requested it. 
 
Please let me know if and you wish to proceed. Thank you.
 
Adam

Good afternoon Adam,
 
Thank you for your time yesterday. I am waiting for you to send me your thoughts post call, as well as, a proposed engagement. I would like to retain your support for 10 hours to start and am hoping you would be open to a discounted hourly rate of $500/hour. I spoke with Ariel, he is a big fan and thought the collaboration opportunity was a great idea. Attached, I am providing the valuation done on LCW per our conversation, as well as, the initial letter I received from Wintrust upon default.
 
Thank you for your expertise in advance. Off topic, I read that you used to be a personal trainer, I do triathlons (have been doing them actively for 11 years) and have a lot of respect for fellow professionals that focus on mind and body health too.
 
Alisa

subject: Re: Alisa - check this
body:
Hey Alisa,
Following up to see if you can benefit from a line of credit or some working capital for Lcw. We have capital ready that we can get you access to within 1–2 business days, without personal guarantees.

We can offer this completely based on revenue—without looking at profit. We typically qualify businesses for amounts between $150K–650K, at just 1% per month.

Want to take a few minutes to explore this? I’m open for a quick call today.

Regards,
Oliver Scott
Account Manager
Flex Group

On Wed, March 19, 2025 2:19 PM, Oliver Scott 

[oliver.s@usrenadvsory.co]> wrote:

> Hi Alisa,
> I thought I’d connect to see if Lcw is currently looking for any immediate lines of credit. We can get you up to $900K, usually the same day.
> 
> We provide capital with no personal guarantees or credit approvals, and we provide funding just based on revenue (not profit).
> 
> Our rates begin at 1% per month.
> 
> Could it be worth it to get on a short chat, Alisa?
> 
> Enjoy the rest of your day,
> Oliver Scott
> Account Manager
> Flex Group

subject: Reminder to Register for Tomorrow’s FortneyScott Webinar: Trump Administration's Focus on Higher Ed
body:
View in browser
 
 
Reminder to Register for Tomorrow's Webinar:
Trump Administration’s Focus on Higher Education
Tomorrow, 
March 25th, from 12:00 noon to 1:00 pm ET
, join FortneyScott for its next webinar addressing higher education’s new compliance challenges under the Trump Administration’s focus on diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) and antisemitism. 
During this free webinar, FortneyScott's experienced practitioners will:
Catalogue the Administration’s activities focused on Higher Education;
Trace the trends across agencies;
Discuss expanded use of Title VI; and,
Provide practical guidance for all employers.
To register for this webinar,

.  For additional information, be sure to visit FortneyScott’s

subject: Join Our April Film Screening!
body:
Dear Friends,
I’m thrilled to invite you to our upcoming double feature of the animated short 
American Sikh
 and the documentary 
Colonel Kalsi: Beyond the Call
. The event will take place on Tuesday, April 15th, 6:00 - 8:30PM ET, at the American Arbitration Association, 150 East 42nd Street.
Register here to join us virtually or in person!
The screenings will be followed by a panel discussion with 
American Sikh
’s creator, Vishavjit Singh, and the subject of 
Colonel Kalsi: Beyond the Call
, Colonel Kamaljeet Kalsi. We’ll dive deeper into the films and explore how ethical representation of religion in the media can build empathy across communities. The program will also highlight Representing Religion, Tanenbaum’s latest initiative connecting storytellers with resources by and about religious, spiritual, and faith communities. 
American Sikh
 is an animated autobiographical short that follows Vishavjit Singh’s experience with bigotry as a South Asian American and Sikh man in the U.S. and his journey to becoming a figure of acceptance through a superhero costume. The film encourages us to think about icons of popular culture and representation as pathways to connection and understanding. 
Colonel Kalsi: Beyond the Call
 
captures Dr. Kamal Kalsi’s journey as he enlists in the U.S. military and seeks a religious exemption to uniform requirements that force him to give up practices essential to his Sikh identity. The film follows Colonel Kalsi as he’s granted an exemption by the U.S. Army. Colonel Kalsi subsequently dedicates himself to ensuring that Sikhs serving in the armed services receive the same necessary recognition of their identity. 
I hope you’ll join us to witness these two empowering stories. 
RSVP at the link here!
In anticipation,
Rev. Mark Fowler, CEO, Tanenbaum
 
At this crucial time, you can actively fight religious hatred by supporting Tanenbaum. Our real-world solutions make peace possible in the U.S. and globally.
Donate Today!

subject: Manage HR honors Language Culture Worldwide as the Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service
body:
Hi Alisa,
My name is Priscilla, and I represent 
Manage HR
. As a distinguished publication, we take immense pride in reaching over 129,000 subscribers through our print and digital channels. Our magazine shares news, insights, and expert opinions on the best HR practices from top HR professionals and Business managers specializing in HR functions.
We are reaching out to you with some exciting news! Language Culture Worldwide is shortlisted for inclusion in our upcoming edition as the '
Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service  2025
'.This recognition is based on nominations from our subscribers, who resonated with your company’s expertise in Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service and suggested them to their peers.This recognition underscores your remarkable repute and how your customers and peers are confident on your offerings.
As the 
SOLE company
 recognized, we are pleased to provide your company with reprint rights to showcase its accomplishment.
To commence with this recognition, we would like to feature a profile for your company in this edition, highlighting what makes you unique among hundreds of other companies in the HR domain.Our editorial team will work closely with you to draft a narrative that accurately describes your services. This profile will provide deeper insights into your strategic vision and leadership in this domain, giving potential clients a clear understanding of your offerings.
In addition, this engaging profile will be featured alongside articles from several decision-makers who will share their experiences, insights, and challenges with their peers. This prominent placement will elevate your visibility and influence among decision-makers actively seeking reliable collaborators in this domain.
Our previous clients who received similar recognitions from our magazine have significantly increased their visibility.Furthermore, being showcased in our print and digital platforms has attracted more attention from subscribers and website visitors.Similarly, Language Culture Worldwide can increase its prominence and visibility with the help of this Top Leadership Communication and Culture Change Service recognition.This endorsement from a renowned magazine enhances your credibility, making your services more appealing to prospects.
You can secure reprint rights for this recognition, which include other benefits, such as the recognition logo and the certificate, all for an expense of $ 3,000. Additionally, your company’s profile will be hyperlinked to your website for easy client ingress, from which they can engage with you.
Our magazine follows a peer-to-peer learning approach, featuring insights from senior decision-makers such as Directors of HR Operations, Recruitment & Talent Directors, and others. These industry leaders share their experiences and ideas through our platform, helping readers stay ahead of emerging updates.
I want to connect you with my senior manager to discuss how you can leverage this recognition to increase Language Culture Worldwide's visibility and enhance client conversion, just like our previous clients. Let me know the best time to reach you.
Regards,
Priscilla
______________
Priscilla Nelson
Manage HR
510 972 5010

subject: Small Business Owners Roundtable – Sessions Begin March 27
body:
Dear Alisa:
Running a small business can be challenging—but you don’t have to do it alone. Imagine having a 
trusted group of fellow business owners
 to cheer you on, share insights, and help you overcome obstacles.
Join SCORE's Peer-to-Peer Roundtable Experience
This 
8-session virtual series
, led by 
experienced SCORE mentors
, is designed for 
owners of established businesses
 at any stage of growth. You’ll gain 
new perspectives, honest feedback, and actionable advice
 from fellow entrepreneurs who understand your journey.
Why Join a 
﻿Peer-to-Peer Roundtable?
✅
 
Learning from Others
 – 
Hear real-world experiences from peers who’ve faced similar challenges and opportunities.
✅
 
Accountability & Support
 – Stay on track with a group that offers encouragement, practical advice, and accountability.
 
✅ 
Networking & Collaboration
 – Build valuable relationships that can lead to 
referrals, partnerships, and new opportunities
.
﻿
✅ 
Problem-Solving
 – Tackle business challenges with insights from other owners who’ve been there before.
✅ 
Increased Expertise
 – Tap into the knowledge of outside speakers on topics 
of 
your
 choice.
What You'll Gain:
🔹
 Strategies to 
scale, expand, or pivot
 your business
🔹
 Tools to 
improve marketing, sales, and financial planning
🔹
 Leadership skills to 
build and strengthen your team
🔹
 A 
better work-life balance
 while growing your business
What Small Business Owners Are Saying:
💬

 Friday, March 21, 2025 12:51 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Investor Note LCW
 
Hi, first off I am sorry things are going this way. I know it’s been very challenging for you personally. 
 
In terms of the letter, my main comment is that experienced investors are used to seeing a P/L. Historical and forecasted quarterly. Can show forecast if we do nothing and forecast with all of these cost out actions. Assume your finance leader has this as the banks have probably been asking for it regularly. 
 
And then what the return on new equity would be given the new forecast. I think all the words in here are good but it’s hard to follow without financial statements. At least for me

Subject:
 Fw: Kamlesh Laxman Bolake - 15 minutes meeting
 
 
His current salary is $20,000 USD per year.  The job said its 6 days a week.  He is asking for $32000 but they do that type of massive increase in salary ask.  I had one guy asking for 60k and now he is make 8400 per year.   I'd say he would agree to $20000 as its remote.  Going from office to remote doesn't need a salary increase in my opinion.  
He has done accounting.  He does operations.  And he hires people in his current role.  I'm not sure he is the best fit personality wise, but its good to get some experience with talking to this type of candidate from India.  
Book time to meet with me

subject: Find More Customers and Clients! Effective Sales Prospecting Strategies
body:
Small Business Sales Prospecting
Tuesday, March 25th, 2025, 10am to 12pm Eastern Time
Attend this webinar to participate in our live Q&A!
Reserve My Spot!
 
Prospecting With A Plan!
Prospecting to other businesses with a clear strategy helps you acquire new customers/clients and expand your possibilities.
This webinar will show you how to 
plan and assess your prospecting campaign as you focus on your true target customers.
 
Discover how AI can improve the efficiency and effectiveness of your prospecting practices and outreach as well as helping you with cold-calling challenges.
Two marketing and sales experts will share tools to make your prospecting easier and more focused.
At the end of this webinar, you will have the knowledge and resources to:
Implement the 3 steps of your sales prospecting funnel
 
 
 
Select the optimal sales prospecting tool(s) for your business
 
 
 
Use LinkedIn Sales Navigator to prospect for clients
 
 
 
Create your own “back of envelope” Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool
 
 
 
Understand how AI can assist in developing your prospecting practices and outreach
Know how AI can help you overcome many cold-calling challenges 
Utilize your own CRM tool to prospect
 
 
 
Prepare yourself mentally to successfully prospect
 
 
 
 
Presenter:
Lee Simonson
Founded and operated two 
startup media companies, 14 
years as President of sales and marketing consulting firm, 
SCORE NYC Mentor.
﻿Presenter:
Tim Contado
Sales and marketing 
professional with over 
25 years of experience in 
consumer products sector, 
SCORE NYC Mentor.
 
This webinar is brought to you for free through the generosity of a 
donor who wishes to remain anonymous.
 
REGISTER
 
You must attend the webinar in order to receive the recording.
 
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.
 
 
 
  
  
  
   
SCORE NYC | 
712 H St NE PMB 98848
 | 
Washington, DC 20002 US

subject: Steps to Franchise Ownership – 3/26 @1pm
body:
Another Choice!
 
 
 
 
Still Time To Register
Steps to Franchise Ownership
﻿
Wednesday, March 26th, 1 pm ET
 
Learn if franchise ownership is for you! It has proven to be been quite an appealing career pursuit and/or investment option for many. Naturally, we all think of burgers and donuts, but there are some 4,000 franchise concepts across 250+ industries! Scores of 'wantrepreneurs' have been drawn to it to pursue their entrepreneurial passions in a risk-mitigated manner. Franchises can offer proven models, brand recognition, training & support, marketing assistance, and much more to help you achieve your goals/wants/needs. Franchises come in all shapes and sizes (i.e., full-time vs. semi-involved,) and with varying levels of investment. 
During this webinar, we’ll cover: 
Franchising landscape - definitions, myths, key considerations
Who buys franchises and why do they buy?
Franchise models compared. Why/how do they work? 
Where are today's leading franchise opportunities?
 
Can't Make the Live Session?
 
Don't worry, everyone who registers will receive the slides and recording the day after the webinar. 
 
Register Now
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTER
Frank Dunne
Frank Dunne is a seasoned Franchise Consultant at Frankly Franchising, who helps 'wantrepreneurs' achieve their dreams of business ownership by matching them with the best franchise options based on their skills, goals, interests, budget, and lifestyle. As a Certified Franchise Consultant and a member of the 
International Franchise Professionals Group
, he has access to more than 500+ franchise and non-franchise opportunities in various industries, and can guide clients through an exploration thereof. With more than 15 years experience working as a franchise coach, multi-unit franchisee, franchisor, and outsourced franchise recruiter...Frank has deep industry knowledge and perspective and leverages it to work with qualified clients on a no-cost basis.
 
 
SCORE CARES
SCORE’s caring volunteers are available for mentoring to assist as always by
email, phone & video.
Contact Your Nearest Chapter:
www.score.org
 • 
www.nymetroareascore.org
 
 
SCORE is a nonprofit association dedicated to helping small businesses get off the ground, grow and achieve their goals through education and mentorship. We have been doing
this for more than 50 years.
 
Because our work is supported by the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA), and thanks to our network of 10,000+ volunteers, we are able to deliver our services at no charge or
at a very low cost.
Find out more about our Mission, Vision and Values
 
 
 
NY Metro Area SCORE | 
NY Metro Area SCORE
 Brucker Hall Rockland Community College | 
Suffern, NY 10901 US

body:
Assuming your accounting system is correct and that these numbers tie to the accounting system, the analysis looks good. We can discuss further on Monday. Have a good weekend.
 
Joe

From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, March 21, 2025 12:33 PM
To:
 Joe Wabick <Jwabick@kreshmore.com>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
Please see attached. When works to connect?
 
Alisa Kolodizner 
(She/Her)
CSMO and Managing Partner
LCW

a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com

Sign-up for our newsletter
 
From:
 Joe Wabick <
Jwabick@kreshmore.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 2:03 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
I see the emails, we can work through all this together live. I went ahead and made you a basic template. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

subject: Outlining Your Marketing Strategies
body:
Promte Effectively!
 
 
 
 
Still Time To Register
Outlining Your Marketing Strategies
﻿
Monday, March 24th, 6 pm ET
 
Not sure where to start with your marketing? This webinar will help you outline clear and simple strategies to promote your business effectively. Discover the basics of creating a marketing plan, and choosing the right platforms to reach your audience and grow your brand.
NOTE: this webinar is designed for start-ups. 
 
Can't Make the Live Session?
 
Don't worry, everyone who registers will receive the slides and recording the day after the webinar. 
 
Register Now

Jennifer Shaheen

subject: Your updated 401(k) contribution!
body:
Hi Alisa,
Your contribution has been changed from 100% (30% pre-tax, 70% Roth) to 100% (0% pre-tax, 100% Roth).
This change is effective immediately. However, if Language & Culture Worldwide has already processed payroll for your Apr 1 paycheck, this change will not be applied until the following pay period. (You may check with your employer to confirm whether or not payroll has been processed for Apr 1).
Happy saving,
Team Guideline
Any questions?

Help Center

1412 Chapin Avenue, Burlingame, CA 94010

From:
 Joe Wabick <
Jwabick@kreshmore.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 2:03 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
I see the emails, we can work through all this together live. I went ahead and made you a basic template. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

subject: New address for LCW
body:
Hi!
I went ahead & signed us up for a Northwest Registered Agent (NWRA) mailing address. Here is our new address (since we won't have a physical space anymore):
Language & Culture Worldwide
2501 Chatham Rd #8413
Springfield, IL, 62704, USA
We will have the mail forwarded to me once a month, and I'll take care of it.
@Alisa Kolodizner
 - I made me the main user for NWRA. If you have trouble logging in or need to log in, lmk. 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 - I can contact WeWork & Regus to have any mail forwarded to this new address.
This will take some time, but we will need to notify places of our updated address:
States (unemployment, workers comp) - Nicole to do
Banks, financial institutions, credit cards
Client billing teams
Etc.
We can roll this out slowly. 
LMK if you have any questions at the moment.
Thank you!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Re: Deferred Compensation
body:
I can. 
And I am very much aware that with this note I was loading yet one more thing onto your overflowing plate. That wasn't my primary intention. I hope you know that.
I was just surprised to see another invoice after our conversation. Add to that the fact that I am on the front line of hearing from Andrea and RP how much trust in you and your word has suffered because of the unfilled promise made regarding the deferred compensation. 
That said, I did feel like I needed to speak to this and understand your statement below.
Have a good weekend.
Chuck
 
Chuck Adams 
(He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer
LCW
Office: 
+1.773.938.4285
Mobile: +1.630.373.5068

From:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 19, 2025 2:59 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Deferred Compensation
 
Hey.
 
I know that you have a lot going on, and I don't mean to add to it, but I needed to reach out and let you know that I noticed another payment to Andrew in QBO for $22,500. I thought you said there would be no more payments from LCW. Maybe I misunderstood, but that was the takeaway that I had after our discussion. And I took that in good faith.
 
Given that all of us involved on the front lines in working diligently day in and day out to save the value of LCW have begrudgingly accepted pay cuts recently, and deferred significant pay in the past, all to help the business, this is problematic to me.
 
While I understand that his contributions to you personally have value, to you, I don't see it. Andrea and RP certainly don't see it. None of his actions have contributed in attracting business, retaining business, or servicing the business we have. What I see is busy work on things that have little value to the organization as a whole. We don't need developers or programmers or anything of the sort.
 
You made a personal commitment to Andrea and RP to restore their deferred pay. It is a promise I would not have made but it was made, nonetheless. And all of the qualifiers about profitability and financial health go out the window when we are able to find over $50,000 to pay someone in a personal relationship with you. 
 
LCW owes RP and Andrea $13,038.02. Much to my wife's chagrin, I am not even adding my deferred compensation to that total, Alisa. 
We should pay them. Immediately. Truly.
 
Respectfully,
 
Chuck

Dear GWC Board of Directors,
I'm pleased to share our 
March Mid-Month Momentum Report
, which highlights our progress and upcoming activities.
As you'll see in the report below, we have two exciting premier events scheduled this year that we have sent calendar notices for (if you have not received a calendar notice please let us know):
2025 Annual Golf Outing
 - Monday, August 25th, 9am-6pm at Olympia Fields Country Club
The Crystal Celebration: Transforming Futures - 15 Years of Connecting Talent to Opportunity
 - Thursday, October 9th, 5:30pm-9pm at University Club of Chicago
The report also features our Mission Moment highlighting Yadira Serna's inspiring journey from intern to mentor, along with updates on our Class 16 recruitment (exceeding our application goal by 119%!), job placements, and fundraising progress.
Please review the report at your earliest convenience and note the action items, including making professional introductions for intern opportunities and board give/get fulfillment by March 31st.
Your continued support and dedication to the Genesys Works mission are invaluable as we work together to transform young lives through meaningful career opportunities.

body:
Hi Alisa, I put together the numbers for the things that are going to be hitting our Wintrust deposit account in the next 30 days. We will need to add money (at least $12,000) before 4/5, when I expect the big 401k draft to go out (assuming the scheduling works the way I think it does on their end). subject: Re: Investor Note LCW
body:
Hi, first off I am sorry things are going this way. I know it’s been very challenging for you personally. 
In terms of the letter, my main comment is that experienced investors are used to seeing a P/L. Historical and forecasted quarterly. Can show forecast if we do nothing and forecast with all of these cost out actions. Assume your finance leader has this as the banks have probably been asking for it regularly. 
And then what the return on new equity would be given the new forecast. I think all the words in here are good but it’s hard to follow without financial statements. At least for me

From:
 Joe Wabick <Jwabick@kreshmore.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 2:03 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Setting up time to connect
 
I see the emails, we can work through all this together live. I went ahead and made you a basic template. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import your AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                                                    
i.
     
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected (i.e. if LCW goes out of business, the bank 
should 
be able to collect)
                                                   
ii.
     
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
                                                  
iii.
     
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP. 
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand. If they do, it’s likely the customer won’t pay for that invoice if the business goes under (I would think they’d offset against their deposit if the business closes).
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed, lower the collectability %. 
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
We can then go through each account receivable and note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
In short, you need to layout the AR and match deposits. I don’t know what other assets exist for the company but to the extent there are other assets, you should seek clarity from wintrust if those should be included in this or if it is just an AR analysis. By the looks of it, it is an AR analysis. 
 
In terms of a call, I could do today at 5 (jumping in car for mtg at 540) or tomorrow at 500. We can go through all of this then but I at least wanted you to see the analysis so you could work on the notes we’ll need…
 
Joe

subject: Welcome to Mail Forwarding!
body:
Hello Alisa, 
Thank you for enrolling in our Physical Forward Mail Service!
Your new business address is as follows:
2501 Chatham Rd
 # 
8413
Springfield
, 
IL
 
62704
 
Let us explain how our service works: 
Congratulations! The above is your permanent and completely unique address, for use by only you. You may begin using it immediately. 
Display it on your website, business cards, or client communications.
 Sky’s the limit, really, just please follow the restrictions below.
Ensure that all your mail contains your 
company name
 and a 
unique suite number.
 Your unique suite number ensures that your mail will be placed in your box & physically forwarded to you. If your mail does not have your unique suite number it will be opened & scanned to your account.
We sort out and shred all junk mail.
Please keep in mind we are not a package re-shipper & are not able to forward packages to your clients on your behalf. 
Our team will scan the front of your envelopes & then physically mail it to you once a week using the U.S.A. address on file. You will receive an email notification that will contain your tracking number.
To view the scans of the envelopes so you know what is on the way simply log in to your account 
here
 
and navigate to the Documents Tab. 
We will accept and process your business mail; however, all packages will be refused.
To ensure uninterrupted service, please be sure that your card on file is up to date and that invoices are paid on time. If payment is not received by the due date, your service and access to your unique suite will be canceled in 7 days.
IMPORTANT INFO: 
Kindly refrain from using this address as a drop ship location or shipping address for your company. Please do not use this address as the return address for products shipped with Amazon or any other e-commerce website.
We understand that you may have questions or need assistance along the way. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us anytime. We are always here to help!
 Thank you once again for choosing our mail service. We appreciate your trust and look forward to serving you with a friendly smile.
Northwest Registered Agent LLC

body:

The podcast is specifically focused on insights, lessons and strategies that drive revenue growth and create an Education/Training company that has raving fans. 

Happy to send you a past episode so you can check it out!

I have a few slots available for next week on Monday or Thursday, would you be opposed to a quick conversation?

J Camargo

subject: Reminder: April 21st: Join Visionary Leaders at the Creative Spirit Gala 2025
body:
Help us reach our goal—one million fair-wage opportunities for neurodivergent professionals by 2030.
 
 
 
Join Us on April 21, 2025
at The Board Room at the New York Stock Exchange 
Honoring Our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity
 
 
Donna Murphy 
CEO, Havas Creative & Health Networks
 
 
Raja Rajamannar 
Chief Marketing & Communications Officer, Mastercard
Will You Join Us?
 
We have set a brilliant goal: To empower neurodivergent individuals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the road to financial independence.
Creative Spirit was founded in 2017 to connect neurodiverse professionals with fair-wage jobs at the best companies in the world. Creative Spirit's unique approach, anchored by first-of-its kind coaching, mentoring, and job placement services, boasts a 95% retention rate. 
We work
 
directly with organizations and neurodivergent individuals to create life-altering career growth and lasting success. We believe companies are most successful and innovative when neurodivergent employees are fully included in the workforce. 
Providing these expert services is costly, and the Creative Spirit gala fundraiser provides 95% of the funding needed to serve our candidates at no cost to them. Your support is critical and greatly appreciated. 
Buy Tickets, Donate, Sponsor
 
Sincerely,
Lori Falcone & Martha Riley
Creative Spirit Gala Co-Chairs
 
Sponsorship Details
 
 
Click here
 to buy tickets, donate, and sponsor.
