subject: Attend Springboard's Virtual 2025 MoxieCon!
body:
View this email in your browser
 
 
illustration shows a logo with the words Springboard Consulting dive in with precision in teal and orange lettering. It also has a picture of a diver.
 
 
 
 
 
 
No Travel Required!   April 30 – May 1, 2025
 
Two full days of critical, timely & relevant content for companies who remain committed to...
 The Future of the Workforce, Workplace and Marketplace
Especially for Individuals with Disabilities
 
In addition to two amazing keynote speakers, mainstage sessions will include:
 
Aging & Family Caregivers in the Workplace.
Corporate Travel & Tourism.
Digital Accessibility & Usability.
Disability & the Media.
Disability Employment.
EEOC, Corporate Compliance.
Implicit Bias.
Mental Health.
Universal Design & The Concept of Space.
 
Attend MoxieCon2025 and turn:
Angst --> Action
Confusion --> Clarity
Perceived Threats --> Real Opportunities
 
Register Today 
https://consultspringboard.com/moxiecom-2025-north-america/#tickets-registration
 
ABOUT SPRINGBOARD®
Founded in 2005, Springboard is recognized as the expert in mainstreaming disability in the global workforce, workplace and marketplace. Serving corporations and organizations throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe and Asia, Springboard has become a trusted partner in relation to disability issues and initiatives across virtually every business category. Springboard annually honors exemplary organizational initiatives that promote the outreach, support & engagement of people with disabilities as employees and as consumers through the Disability Matters Awards. 
www.consultspringboard.com
.

body:

Basics
Part 1
 of Our 2-Session Webinar Series
Friday, April 4, 2025, 11am to 1pm Eastern Time
﻿
Attend the workshop to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
Can't make it to the webinar?
Register anyway and we'll send you the recording.
For Google Analytics novices, the perfect webinar!
Google Analytics gives you precise information on the effectiveness of your online marketing and 
suggests ways to improve it. 
﻿New to Analytics, or need a more detailed orientation?
This webinar is for you.
This webinar, led by a Google Analytics expert, will help you set up and use this valuable tool to work for your business! 
 
After this webinar session, you will have the knowledge and resources to:
Comfortably navigate the Google Analytics 4 interface

?

subject: Please review the email I received from one of my executive leaders and then the note I was planning to send to him and my other executive leader. Thanks
body:
Hi Nicole and Chuck,
 
Over the next few weeks there will be some changes, these changes will secure LCW being able to no longer have its debt obligations. Thanks to the past 6 months of changes, I am optimistic for the future. I can not comment too much on a few items, so I would appreciate your trust while we get through this.
 
I am working on onboarding Kevin Cui, 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/kevincuiprofile

Kevin Cui - MAN Marketing - LinkedIn
Passion in helping companies scale, improve operations, and drive sustainable growth… · Experience: MAN Marketing · Education: Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management ...
www.linkedin.com
as a minority operating partner. Kevin will support and enhance the companies leadership by working closely with both of you. His focus will be on strategic guidance, marketing and sales initiatives, replace my role in all financial week to week and monthly decisions, while working with Nicole. Andrew has been instrumental in helping me through the transition and his restructuring and advisory role will be transitioned to Kevin. 
 
In regards to recent bills being paid, I am working through ensuring that all steps are taken to put LCW in a healthier spot. Please trust me as I am going through many decisions and I am trying my best to get through this. I cannot get through this if there are more items being added to my plate. I appreciate it in advance. 
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner

subject: The next few weeks
body:
Hi Nicole and Chuck,
Over the next few weeks there will be some changes, these changes will secure LCW being able to no longer have its debt obligations. Thanks to the past 6 months of changes, I am optimistic for the future. I can not comment too much on a few items, so I would appreciate your trust while we get through this.
I am working on onboarding Kevin Cui, 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/kevincuiprofile
, as an operating partner, Kevin will support and enhance the companies leadership by working closely with both of you. His focus will be on strategic guidance, marketing and sales initiatives, replace my role in all financial week to week and monthly decisions, while working with Nicole. His role is designed to provide leadership support, improve financial processes, and create an opportunity for equity participation, ensuring key leadership is aligned with the companies long-term success. Andrew has been instrumental in helping me through the transition and his restructuring and advisory role will be transitioned to Kevin. 
In regards to recent bills being paid, I am working through ensuring that all steps are taken to put LCW in a healthier spot. I need your trust as we go through this process and appreciate it in advance.

subject: Autism Awareness & Action – April 17
body:
Autism Speaks – Redefine Possible 
 
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
UPCOMING EVENT
 
Autism Speaks
 
– Redefine Possible
 
THURSDAY, APRIL 17, 2025
12:00 
—
 1:00 PM CST
VIRTUAL EVENT
REGISTER NOW
 
Join the Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
 Emerging Leaders
 and 
Autism Speaks
 for a special event in honor of 
World Autism Month
. This engaging session will explore autism awareness, workplace inclusion, and the ways businesses can better support employees with autism. Attendees will gain valuable insights into fostering an inclusive work environment and learn practical strategies to help redefine what’s possible in the workplace.
 
Hear from experts at Autism Speaks, including 
Heidi Meier, Senior Manager of Community Engagement for the Upper Mid-West; Nate Smith, Director of Corporate Initiatives; and Colleen Shinn, Director of Community Outreach.
Through insightful discussions, you’ll gain a deeper understanding of how organizations can create opportunities for individuals with autism to thrive.
 
Don’t miss this opportunity to connect with professionals, expand your knowledge, and take meaningful steps toward workplace inclusion!
   EVENT PARTNER
 
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER
 
 
 
 
 
WWW.CHICAGOLANDCHAMBER.ORG
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
